availableParameters.name: build_volume_fan_nr
availableParameters.title: Build volume fan number
availableParameters.description: The number of the fan that cools the build volume. If this is set to 0, it's means that there is no build volume fan

availableParameters.name: machine_name
availableParameters.title: Machine Type
availableParameters.description: The name of your 3D printer model.

availableParameters.name: machine_show_variants
availableParameters.title: Show Machine Variants
availableParameters.description: Whether to show the different variants of this machine, which are described in separate json files.

availableParameters.name: machine_start_gcode
availableParameters.title: Start G-code
availableParameters.description: G-code commands to be executed at the very start - separated by \n.

defaultValue.expression:
G28 ;Home
G1 Z15.0 F6000 ;Move the platform down 15mm
;Prime the extruder
G92 E0
G1 F200 E3
G92 E0

availableParameters.name: machine_end_gcode
availableParameters.title: End G-code
availableParameters.description: G-code commands to be executed at the very end - separated by \n.

defaultValue.expression:
M104 S0
M140 S0
;Retract the filament
G92 E1
G1 E-1 F300
G28 X0 Y0
M84

availableParameters.name: material_guid
availableParameters.title: Material GUID
availableParameters.description: GUID of the material. This is set automatically.

availableParameters.name: material_type
availableParameters.title: Material Type
availableParameters.description: The type of material used.

availableParameters.name: material_brand
availableParameters.title: Material Brand
availableParameters.description: The brand of material used.

availableParameters.name: material_diameter
availableParameters.title: Diameter
availableParameters.description: Adjusts the diameter of the filament used. Match this value with the diameter of the used filament.

availableParameters.name: material_bed_temp_wait
availableParameters.title: Wait for Build Plate Heatup
availableParameters.description: Whether to insert a command to wait until the build plate temperature is reached at the start.

availableParameters.name: material_print_temp_wait
availableParameters.title: Wait for Nozzle Heatup
availableParameters.description: Whether to wait until the nozzle temperature is reached at the start.

availableParameters.name: material_print_temp_prepend
availableParameters.title: Include Material Temperatures
availableParameters.description: Whether to include nozzle temperature commands at the start of the gcode. When the start_gcode already contains nozzle temperature commands Cura frontend will automatically disable this setting.

availableParameters.name: material_bed_temp_prepend
availableParameters.title: Include Build Plate Temperature
availableParameters.description: Whether to include build plate temperature commands at the start of the gcode. When the start_gcode already contains build plate temperature commands Cura frontend will automatically disable this setting.

availableParameters.name: machine_width
availableParameters.title: Machine Width
availableParameters.description: The width (X-direction) of the printable area.

availableParameters.name: machine_depth
availableParameters.title: Machine Depth
availableParameters.description: The depth (Y-direction) of the printable area.

availableParameters.name: machine_height
availableParameters.title: Machine Height
availableParameters.description: The height (Z-direction) of the printable area.

availableParameters.name: machine_shape
availableParameters.title: Build Plate Shape
availableParameters.description: The shape of the build plate without taking unprintable areas into account.

availableParameters.name: machine_buildplate_type
availableParameters.title: Build Plate Type
availableParameters.description: The type of build plate installed on the printer.

availableParameters.name: machine_heated_bed
availableParameters.title: Has Heated Build Plate
availableParameters.description: Whether the machine has a heated build plate present.

availableParameters.name: machine_heated_build_volume
availableParameters.title: Has Build Volume Temperature Stabilization
availableParameters.description: Whether the machine is able to stabilize the build volume temperature.

availableParameters.name: machine_always_write_active_tool
availableParameters.title: Always Write Active Tool
availableParameters.description: Write active tool after sending temp commands to inactive tool. Required for Dual Extruder printing with Smoothie or other firmware with modal tool commands.

availableParameters.name: machine_center_is_zero
availableParameters.title: Is Center Origin
availableParameters.description: Whether the X/Y coordinates of the zero position of the printer is at the center of the printable area.

availableParameters.name: machine_extruder_count
availableParameters.title: Number of Extruders
availableParameters.description: Number of extruder trains. An extruder train is the combination of a feeder, bowden tube, and nozzle.

availableParameters.name: extruders_enabled_count
availableParameters.title: Number of Extruders That Are Enabled
availableParameters.description: Number of extruder trains that are enabled; automatically set in software

availableParameters.name: machine_nozzle_tip_outer_diameter
availableParameters.title: Outer Nozzle Diameter
availableParameters.description: The outer diameter of the tip of the nozzle.

availableParameters.name: machine_nozzle_expansion_angle
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Angle
availableParameters.description: The angle between the horizontal plane and the conical part right above the tip of the nozzle.

availableParameters.name: machine_heat_zone_length
availableParameters.title: Heat Zone Length
availableParameters.description: The distance from the tip of the nozzle in which heat from the nozzle is transferred to the filament.

availableParameters.name: machine_nozzle_temp_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Nozzle Temperature Control
availableParameters.description: Whether to control temperature from Cura. Turn this off to control nozzle temperature from outside of Cura.

availableParameters.name: machine_nozzle_heat_up_speed
availableParameters.title: Heat Up Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed (°C/s) by which the nozzle heats up averaged over the window of normal printing temperatures and the standby temperature.

availableParameters.name: machine_nozzle_cool_down_speed
availableParameters.title: Cool Down Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed (°C/s) by which the nozzle cools down averaged over the window of normal printing temperatures and the standby temperature.

availableParameters.name: machine_min_cool_heat_time_window
availableParameters.title: Minimal Time Standby Temperature
availableParameters.description: The minimal time an extruder has to be inactive before the nozzle is cooled. Only when an extruder is not used for longer than this time will it be allowed to cool down to the standby temperature.

availableParameters.name: machine_gcode_flavor
availableParameters.title: G-code Flavor
availableParameters.description: The type of g-code to be generated.

availableParameters.name: machine_firmware_retract
availableParameters.title: Firmware Retraction
availableParameters.description: Whether to use firmware retract commands (G10/G11) instead of using the E property in G1 commands to retract the material.

availableParameters.name: machine_extruders_share_heater
availableParameters.title: Extruders Share Heater
availableParameters.description: Whether the extruders share a single heater rather than each extruder having its own heater.

availableParameters.name: machine_extruders_share_nozzle
availableParameters.title: Extruders Share Nozzle
availableParameters.description: Whether the extruders share a single nozzle rather than each extruder having its own nozzle. When set to true, it is expected that the printer-start gcode script properly sets up all extruders in an initial retraction state that is known and mutually compatible (either zero or one filament not retracted); in that case the initial retraction status is described, per extruder, by the 'machine_extruders_shared_nozzle_initial_retraction' parameter.

availableParameters.name: machine_extruders_shared_nozzle_initial_retraction
availableParameters.title: Shared Nozzle Initial Retraction
availableParameters.description: How much the filament of each extruder is assumed to have been retracted from the shared nozzle tip at the completion of the printer-start gcode script; the value should be equal to or greater than the length of the common part of the nozzle's ducts.

availableParameters.name: machine_disallowed_areas
availableParameters.title: Disallowed Areas
availableParameters.description: A list of polygons with areas the print head is not allowed to enter.

availableParameters.name: nozzle_disallowed_areas
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Disallowed Areas
availableParameters.description: A list of polygons with areas the nozzle is not allowed to enter.

availableParameters.name: machine_head_with_fans_polygon
availableParameters.title: Machine Head & Fan Polygon
availableParameters.description: The dimensions of the print head used to determine 'Safe Model Distance' when printing 'One at a Time'. These numbers relate to the centerline of the first extruder nozzle. Left of the nozzle is 'X Min' and must be negative.  Rear of the nozzle is 'Y Min' and must be negative.  X Max (right) and Y Max (front) are positive numbers.  Gantry height is the dimension from the build plate to the X gantry beam.

availableParameters.name: gantry_height
availableParameters.title: Gantry Height
availableParameters.description: The height difference between the tip of the nozzle and the gantry system (X and Y axes).

availableParameters.name: machine_time_estimation_factor
availableParameters.title: Print Time Estimation Factor
availableParameters.description: Multiplier for adjusting print time estimates. 100% shows original estimate. Higher values indicate longer actual print times.

availableParameters.name: machine_nozzle_id
availableParameters.title: Nozzle ID
availableParameters.description: The nozzle ID for an extruder train, such as "AA 0.4" and "BB 0.8".

availableParameters.name: machine_nozzle_size
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Diameter
availableParameters.description: The inner diameter of the nozzle. Change this setting when using a non-standard nozzle size.

availableParameters.name: machine_use_extruder_offset_to_offset_coords
availableParameters.title: Offset with Extruder
availableParameters.description: Apply the extruder offset to the coordinate system. Affects all extruders.

availableParameters.name: machine_start_gcode_first
availableParameters.title: Start GCode must be first
availableParameters.description: This setting controls if the start-gcode is forced to always be the first g-code. Without this option other g-code, such as a T0 can be inserted before the start g-code.

availableParameters.name: extruder_prime_pos_z
availableParameters.title: Extruder Prime Z Position
availableParameters.description: The Z coordinate of the position where the nozzle primes at the start of printing.

availableParameters.name: extruder_prime_pos_abs
availableParameters.title: Absolute Extruder Prime Position
availableParameters.description: Make the extruder prime position absolute rather than relative to the last-known location of the head.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_feedrate_x
availableParameters.title: Maximum Speed X
availableParameters.description: The maximum speed for the motor of the X-direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_feedrate_y
availableParameters.title: Maximum Speed Y
availableParameters.description: The maximum speed for the motor of the Y-direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_feedrate_z
availableParameters.title: Maximum Speed Z
availableParameters.description: The maximum speed for the motor of the Z-direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_feedrate_e
availableParameters.title: Maximum Speed E
availableParameters.description: The maximum speed of the filament.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_acceleration_x
availableParameters.title: Maximum Acceleration X
availableParameters.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the X-direction

availableParameters.name: machine_max_acceleration_y
availableParameters.title: Maximum Acceleration Y
availableParameters.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the Y-direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_acceleration_z
availableParameters.title: Maximum Acceleration Z
availableParameters.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the Z-direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_acceleration_e
availableParameters.title: Maximum Filament Acceleration
availableParameters.description: Maximum acceleration for the motor of the filament.

availableParameters.name: machine_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Default Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The default acceleration of print head movement.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_jerk_xy
availableParameters.title: Default X-Y Jerk
availableParameters.description: Default jerk for movement in the horizontal plane.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_jerk_z
availableParameters.title: Default Z Jerk
availableParameters.description: Default jerk for the motor of the Z-direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_max_jerk_e
availableParameters.title: Default Filament Jerk
availableParameters.description: Default jerk for the motor of the filament.

availableParameters.name: machine_steps_per_mm_x
availableParameters.title: Steps per Millimeter (X)
availableParameters.description: How many steps of the stepper motor will result in one millimeter of movement in the X direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_steps_per_mm_y
availableParameters.title: Steps per Millimeter (Y)
availableParameters.description: How many steps of the stepper motor will result in one millimeter of movement in the Y direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_steps_per_mm_z
availableParameters.title: Steps per Millimeter (Z)
availableParameters.description: How many steps of the stepper motor will result in one millimeter of movement in the Z direction.

availableParameters.name: machine_steps_per_mm_e
availableParameters.title: Steps per Millimeter (E)
availableParameters.description: How many steps of the stepper motors will result in moving the feeder wheel by one millimeter around its circumference.

availableParameters.name: machine_endstop_positive_direction_x
availableParameters.title: X Endstop in Positive Direction
availableParameters.description: Whether the endstop of the X axis is in the positive direction (high X coordinate) or negative (low X coordinate).

availableParameters.name: machine_endstop_positive_direction_y
availableParameters.title: Y Endstop in Positive Direction
availableParameters.description: Whether the endstop of the Y axis is in the positive direction (high Y coordinate) or negative (low Y coordinate).

availableParameters.name: machine_endstop_positive_direction_z
availableParameters.title: Z Endstop in Positive Direction
availableParameters.description: Whether the endstop of the Z axis is in the positive direction (high Z coordinate) or negative (low Z coordinate).

availableParameters.name: machine_minimum_feedrate
availableParameters.title: Minimum Feedrate
availableParameters.description: The minimal movement speed of the print head.

availableParameters.name: machine_feeder_wheel_diameter
availableParameters.title: Feeder Wheel Diameter
availableParameters.description: The diameter of the wheel that drives the material in the feeder.

availableParameters.name: machine_scale_fan_speed_zero_to_one
availableParameters.title: Scale Fan Speed To 0-1
availableParameters.description: Scale the fan speed to be between 0 and 1 instead of between 0 and 256.

availableParameters.name: reset_flow_duration
availableParameters.title: Reset flow duration
availableParameters.description: For any travel move longer than this value, the material flow is reset to the paths target flow

availableParameters.name: layer_height
availableParameters.title: Layer Height
availableParameters.description: The height of each layer in mm. Higher values produce faster prints in lower resolution, lower values produce slower prints in higher resolution.

availableParameters.name: layer_height_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Height
availableParameters.description: The height of the initial layer in mm. A thicker initial layer makes adhesion to the build plate easier.

availableParameters.name: line_width
availableParameters.title: Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single line. Generally, the width of each line should correspond to the width of the nozzle. However, slightly reducing this value could produce better prints.

availableParameters.name: wall_line_width
availableParameters.title: Wall Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single wall line.

availableParameters.name: wall_line_width_0
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of the outermost wall line. By lowering this value, higher levels of detail can be printed.

availableParameters.name: wall_line_width_x
availableParameters.title: Inner Wall(s) Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single wall line for all wall lines except the outermost one.

availableParameters.name: skin_line_width
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single top/bottom line.

availableParameters.name: infill_line_width
availableParameters.title: Infill Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single infill line.

availableParameters.name: skirt_brim_line_width
availableParameters.title: Skirt/Brim Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single skirt or brim line.

availableParameters.name: support_line_width
availableParameters.title: Support Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single support structure line.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_line_width
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single line of support roof or floor.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_line_width
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single support roof line.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_line_width
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single support floor line.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_line_width
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single prime tower line.

availableParameters.name: initial_layer_line_width_factor
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Line Width
availableParameters.description: Multiplier of the line width on the first layer. Increasing this could improve bed adhesion.

availableParameters.name: wall_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Wall Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train used for printing the walls. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train used for printing the outer wall. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: wall_x_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Inner Wall Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train used for printing the inner walls. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: wall_thickness
availableParameters.title: Wall Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness of the walls in the horizontal direction. This value divided by the wall line width defines the number of walls.

availableParameters.name: wall_line_count
availableParameters.title: Wall Line Count
availableParameters.description: The number of walls. When calculated by the wall thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

defaultValue.expression: magic_spiralize ? 1 : Math.max(1, round((wall_thickness - wall_line_width_0) / wall_line_width_x) + 1) if wall_thickness != 0 else 0

availableParameters.name: wall_transition_length
availableParameters.title: Wall Transition Length
availableParameters.description: When transitioning between different numbers of walls as the part becomes thinner, a certain amount of space is allotted to split or join the wall lines.

availableParameters.name: wall_distribution_count
availableParameters.title: Wall Distribution Count
availableParameters.description: The number of walls, counted from the center, over which the variation needs to be spread. Lower values mean that the outer walls don't change in width.

availableParameters.name: wall_transition_angle
availableParameters.title: Wall Transitioning Threshold Angle
availableParameters.description: When to create transitions between even and odd numbers of walls. A wedge shape with an angle greater than this setting will not have transitions and no walls will be printed in the center to fill the remaining space. Reducing this setting reduces the number and length of these center walls, but may leave gaps or overextrude.

availableParameters.name: wall_transition_filter_distance
availableParameters.title: Wall Transitioning Filter Distance
availableParameters.description: If it would be transitioning back and forth between different numbers of walls in quick succession, don't transition at all. Remove transitions if they are closer together than this distance.

availableParameters.name: wall_transition_filter_deviation
availableParameters.title: Wall Transitioning Filter Margin
availableParameters.description: Prevent transitioning back and forth between one extra wall and one less. This margin extends the range of line widths which follow to [Minimum Wall Line Width - Margin, 2 * Minimum Wall Line Width + Margin]. Increasing this margin reduces the number of transitions, which reduces the number of extrusion starts/stops and travel time. However, large line width variation can lead to under- or overextrusion problems.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_wipe_dist
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Wipe Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance of a travel move inserted after the outer wall, to hide the Z seam better.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_inset
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Inset
availableParameters.description: Inset applied to the path of the outer wall. If the outer wall is smaller than the nozzle, and printed after the inner walls, use this offset to get the hole in the nozzle to overlap with the inner walls instead of the outside of the model.

availableParameters.name: optimize_wall_printing_order
availableParameters.title: Optimize Wall Printing Order
availableParameters.description: Optimize the order in which walls are printed so as to reduce the number of retractions and the distance travelled. Most parts will benefit from this being enabled but some may actually take longer so please compare the print time estimates with and without optimization. First layer is not optimized when choosing brim as build plate adhesion type.

availableParameters.name: inset_direction
availableParameters.title: Wall Ordering
availableParameters.description: Determines the order in which walls are printed. Printing outer walls earlier helps with dimensional accuracy, as faults from inner walls cannot propagate to the outside. However printing them later allows them to stack better when overhangs are printed. When there is an uneven amount of total innner walls, the 'center last line' is always printed last.

availableParameters.name: alternate_extra_perimeter
availableParameters.title: Alternate Extra Wall
availableParameters.description: Prints an extra wall at every other layer. This way infill gets caught between these extra walls, resulting in stronger prints.

availableParameters.name: min_wall_line_width
availableParameters.title: Minimum Wall Line Width
availableParameters.description: For thin structures around once or twice the nozzle size, the line widths need to be altered to adhere to the thickness of the model. This setting controls the minimum line width allowed for the walls. The minimum line widths inherently also determine the maximum line widths, since we transition from N to N+1 walls at some geometry thickness where the N walls are wide and the N+1 walls are narrow. The widest possible wall line is twice the Minimum Wall Line Width.

availableParameters.name: min_even_wall_line_width
availableParameters.title: Minimum Even Wall Line Width
availableParameters.description: The minimum line width for normal polygonal walls. This setting determines at which model thickness we switch from printing a single thin wall line, to printing two wall lines. A higher Minimum Even Wall Line Width leads to a higher maximum odd wall line width. The maximum even wall line width is calculated as Outer Wall Line Width + 0.5 * Minimum Odd Wall Line Width.

availableParameters.name: min_odd_wall_line_width
availableParameters.title: Minimum Odd Wall Line Width
availableParameters.description: The minimum line width for middle line gap filler polyline walls. This setting determines at which model thickness we switch from printing two wall lines, to printing two outer walls and a single central wall in the middle. A higher Minimum Odd Wall Line Width leads to a higher maximum even wall line width. The maximum odd wall line width is calculated as 2 * Minimum Even Wall Line Width.

availableParameters.name: fill_outline_gaps
availableParameters.title: Print Thin Walls
availableParameters.description: Print pieces of the model which are horizontally thinner than the nozzle size.

availableParameters.name: min_feature_size
availableParameters.title: Minimum Feature Size
availableParameters.description: Minimum thickness of thin features. Model features that are thinner than this value will not be printed, while features thicker than the Minimum Feature Size will be widened to the Minimum Wall Line Width.

availableParameters.name: min_bead_width
availableParameters.title: Minimum Thin Wall Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of the wall that will replace thin features (according to the Minimum Feature Size) of the model. If the Minimum Wall Line Width is thinner than the thickness of the feature, the wall will become as thick as the feature itself.

availableParameters.name: xy_offset
availableParameters.title: Horizontal Expansion
availableParameters.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in each layer. Positive values can compensate for too big holes; negative values can compensate for too small holes.

availableParameters.name: xy_offset_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Horizontal Expansion
availableParameters.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in the first layer. A negative value can compensate for squishing of the first layer known as "elephant's foot".

availableParameters.name: hole_xy_offset
availableParameters.title: Hole Horizontal Expansion
availableParameters.description: When greater than zero, the Hole Horizontal Expansion is the amount of offset applied to all holes in each layer. Positive values increase the size of the holes, negative values reduce the size of the holes. When this setting is enabled it can be further tuned with Hole Horizontal Expansion Max Diameter.

availableParameters.name: hole_xy_offset_max_diameter
availableParameters.title: Hole Horizontal Expansion Max Diameter
availableParameters.description: When greater than zero, the Hole Horizontal Expansion is gradually applied on small holes (small holes are expanded more). When set to zero the Hole Horizontal Expansion will be applied to all holes. Holes larger than the Hole Horizontal Expansion Max Diameter are not expanded.

availableParameters.name: z_seam_type
availableParameters.title: Z Seam Alignment
availableParameters.description: Starting point of each path in a layer. When paths in consecutive layers start at the same point a vertical seam may show on the print. When aligning these near a user specified location, the seam is easiest to remove. When placed randomly the inaccuracies at the paths' start will be less noticeable. When taking the shortest path the print will be quicker.

availableParameters.name: z_seam_on_vertex
availableParameters.title: Z Seam On Vertex
availableParameters.description: Place the z-seam on a polygon vertex. Switching this off can place the seam between vertices as well. (Keep in mind that this won't override the restrictions on placing the seam on an unsupported overhang.)

availableParameters.name: z_seam_position
availableParameters.title: Z Seam Position
availableParameters.description: The position near where to start printing each part in a layer.

availableParameters.name: z_seam_x
availableParameters.title: Z Seam X
availableParameters.description: The X coordinate of the position near where to start printing each part in a layer.

defaultValue.expression: (z_seam_position == 'frontleft' || z_seam_position == 'left' || z_seam_position == 'backleft') ? (0 : machine_width / 2 if (z_seam_position == 'front' || z_seam_position == 'back') else machine_width) - (machine_width / 2 if z_seam_relative || machine_center_is_zero else 0)

availableParameters.name: z_seam_y
availableParameters.title: Z Seam Y
availableParameters.description: The Y coordinate of the position near where to start printing each part in a layer.

defaultValue.expression: (z_seam_position == 'frontleft' || z_seam_position == 'front' || z_seam_position == 'frontright') ? (0 : machine_depth / 2 if (z_seam_position == 'left' || z_seam_position == 'right') else machine_depth) - (machine_depth / 2 if z_seam_relative || machine_center_is_zero else 0)

availableParameters.name: z_seam_corner
availableParameters.title: Seam Corner Preference
availableParameters.description: Control how corners on the model outline influence the position of the seam. Hide Seam makes the seam more likely to occur on an inside corner. Expose Seam makes the seam more likely to occur on an outside corner. Hide or Expose Seam makes the seam more likely to occur at an inside or outside corner. Smart Hiding allows both inside and outside corners, but chooses inside corners more frequently, if appropriate.

availableParameters.name: z_seam_relative
availableParameters.title: Z Seam Relative
availableParameters.description: When enabled, the z seam coordinates are relative to each part's centre. When disabled, the coordinates define an absolute position on the build plate.

availableParameters.name: roofing_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train used for printing the top most skin. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: roofing_layer_count
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Layers
availableParameters.description: The number of top most skin layers. Usually only one top most layer is sufficient to generate higher quality top surfaces.

availableParameters.name: roofing_line_width
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single line of the areas at the top of the print.

availableParameters.name: roofing_pattern
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern of the top most layers.

availableParameters.name: roofing_monotonic
availableParameters.title: Monotonic Top Surface Order
availableParameters.description: Print top surface lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.

availableParameters.name: roofing_angles
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use when the top surface skin layers use the lines or zig zag pattern. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees).

availableParameters.name: roofing_expansion
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Expansion
availableParameters.description: Determines how much the top surfaces are expanded beneath overlapping surfaces. By adjusting this value, you can ensure that the outer edges of the top surfaces are concealed by the layers above, resulting in a better visual quality, particularly for models with curved surfaces.

availableParameters.name: flooring_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train used for printing the bottom most skin. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: flooring_layer_count
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Layers
availableParameters.description: The number of bottom most skin layers. Usually only one bottom most layer is sufficient to generate higher quality bottom surfaces.

availableParameters.name: flooring_line_width
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of a single line of the areas at the bottom of the print.

availableParameters.name: flooring_pattern
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern of the bottom most layers.

availableParameters.name: flooring_monotonic
availableParameters.title: Monotonic Bottom Surface Order
availableParameters.description: Print bottom surface lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.

availableParameters.name: flooring_angles
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use when the bottom surface skin layers use the lines or zig zag pattern. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees).

availableParameters.name: top_bottom_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train used for printing the top and bottom skin. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: top_bottom_thickness
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness of the top/bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top/bottom layers.

availableParameters.name: top_thickness
availableParameters.title: Top Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness of the top layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of top layers.

availableParameters.name: top_layers
availableParameters.title: Top Layers
availableParameters.description: The number of top layers. When calculated by the top thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

availableParameters.name: bottom_thickness
availableParameters.title: Bottom Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness of the bottom layers in the print. This value divided by the layer height defines the number of bottom layers.

availableParameters.name: bottom_layers
availableParameters.title: Bottom Layers
availableParameters.description: The number of bottom layers. When calculated by the bottom thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

availableParameters.name: initial_bottom_layers
availableParameters.title: Initial Bottom Layers
availableParameters.description: The number of initial bottom layers, from the build-plate upwards. When calculated by the bottom thickness, this value is rounded to a whole number.

availableParameters.name: top_bottom_pattern
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern of the top/bottom layers.

availableParameters.name: top_bottom_pattern_0
availableParameters.title: Bottom Pattern Initial Layer
availableParameters.description: The pattern on the bottom of the print on the first layer.

availableParameters.name: connect_skin_polygons
availableParameters.title: Connect Top/Bottom Polygons
availableParameters.description: Connect top/bottom skin paths where they run next to each other. For the concentric pattern enabling this setting greatly reduces the travel time, but because the connections can happen midway over infill this feature can reduce the top surface quality.

availableParameters.name: skin_monotonic
availableParameters.title: Monotonic Top/Bottom Order
availableParameters.description: Print top/bottom lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.

availableParameters.name: skin_angles
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use when the top/bottom layers use the lines or zig zag pattern. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees).

availableParameters.name: small_skin_width
availableParameters.title: Small Top/Bottom Width
availableParameters.description: Small top/bottom regions are filled with walls instead of the default top/bottom pattern. This helps to avoids jerky motions. Off for the topmost (air-exposed) layer by default (see 'Small Top/Bottom On Surface').

availableParameters.name: small_skin_on_surface
availableParameters.title: Small Top/Bottom On Surface
availableParameters.description: Enable small (up to 'Small Top/Bottom Width') regions on the topmost skinned layer (exposed to air) to be filled with walls instead of the default pattern.

availableParameters.name: skin_no_small_gaps_heuristic
availableParameters.title: No Skin in Z Gaps
availableParameters.description: When the model has small vertical gaps of only a few layers, there should normally be skin around those layers in the narrow space. Enable this setting to not generate skin if the vertical gap is very small. This improves printing time and slicing time, but technically leaves infill exposed to the air.

availableParameters.name: skin_outline_count
availableParameters.title: Extra Skin Wall Count
availableParameters.description: Replaces the outermost part of the top/bottom pattern with a number of concentric lines. Using one or two lines improves roofs that start on infill material.

availableParameters.name: ironing_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Ironing
availableParameters.description: Go over the top surface one additional time, but this time extruding very little material. This is meant to melt the plastic on top further, creating a smoother surface. The pressure in the nozzle chamber is kept high so that the creases in the surface are filled with material.

availableParameters.name: ironing_only_highest_layer
availableParameters.title: Iron Only Highest Layer
availableParameters.description: Only perform ironing on the very last layer of the mesh. This saves time if the lower layers don't need a smooth surface finish.

availableParameters.name: ironing_pattern
availableParameters.title: Ironing Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern to use for ironing top surfaces.

availableParameters.name: ironing_monotonic
availableParameters.title: Monotonic Ironing Order
availableParameters.description: Print ironing lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes flat surfaces look more consistent.

availableParameters.name: ironing_line_spacing
availableParameters.title: Ironing Line Spacing
availableParameters.description: The distance between the lines of ironing.

availableParameters.name: ironing_flow
availableParameters.title: Ironing Flow
availableParameters.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal skin line, to extrude during ironing. Keeping the nozzle filled helps filling some of the crevices of the top surface, but too much results in overextrusion and blips on the side of the surface.

availableParameters.name: ironing_inset
availableParameters.title: Ironing Inset
availableParameters.description: A distance to keep from the edges of the model. Ironing all the way to the edge of the mesh may result in a jagged edge on your print.

defaultValue.expression: ironing_pattern == 'concentric' ? wall_line_width_0 / 2 + (ironing_line_spacing - skin_line_width * (1.0 + ironing_flow / 100) / 2 : skin_line_width * (1.0 - ironing_flow / 100) / 2)

availableParameters.name: speed_ironing
availableParameters.title: Ironing Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which to pass over the top surface.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_ironing
availableParameters.title: Ironing Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which ironing is performed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_ironing
availableParameters.title: Ironing Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change while performing ironing.

availableParameters.name: skin_overlap
availableParameters.title: Skin Overlap Percentage
availableParameters.description: Adjust the amount of overlap between the walls and (the endpoints of) the skin-centerlines, as a percentage of the line widths of the skin lines and the innermost wall. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the skin. Note that, given an equal skin and wall line-width, any percentage over 50% may already cause any skin to go past the wall, because at that point the position of the nozzle of the skin-extruder may already reach past the middle of the wall.

availableParameters.name: skin_overlap_mm
availableParameters.title: Skin Overlap
availableParameters.description: Adjust the amount of overlap between the walls and (the endpoints of) the skin-centerlines. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the skin. Note that, given an equal skin and wall line-width, any value over half the width of the wall may already cause any skin to go past the wall, because at that point the position of the nozzle of the skin-extruder may already reach past the middle of the wall.

defaultValue.expression: wall_line_count > 1 ? 0.5 * (skin_line_width + (wall_line_width_x : wall_line_width_0)) * skin_overlap / 100 if top_bottom_pattern != 'concentric' else 0

availableParameters.name: skin_preshrink
availableParameters.title: Skin Removal Width
availableParameters.description: The largest width of skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing top/bottom skin at slanted surfaces in the model.

availableParameters.name: top_skin_preshrink
availableParameters.title: Top Skin Removal Width
availableParameters.description: The largest width of top skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing top skin at slanted surfaces in the model.

availableParameters.name: bottom_skin_preshrink
availableParameters.title: Bottom Skin Removal Width
availableParameters.description: The largest width of bottom skin areas which are to be removed. Every skin area smaller than this value will disappear. This can help in limiting the amount of time and material spent on printing bottom skin at slanted surfaces in the model.

availableParameters.name: expand_skins_expand_distance
availableParameters.title: Skin Expand Distance
availableParameters.description: The distance the skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the walls on neighboring layers adhere better to the skin. Lower values save amount of material used.

availableParameters.name: top_skin_expand_distance
availableParameters.title: Top Skin Expand Distance
availableParameters.description: The distance the top skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the walls on the layer above adhere better to the skin. Lower values save amount of material used.

availableParameters.name: bottom_skin_expand_distance
availableParameters.title: Bottom Skin Expand Distance
availableParameters.description: The distance the bottom skins are expanded into the infill. Higher values makes the skin attach better to the infill pattern and makes the skin adhere better to the walls on the layer below. Lower values save amount of material used.

availableParameters.name: max_skin_angle_for_expansion
availableParameters.title: Maximum Skin Angle for Expansion
availableParameters.description: Top and/or bottom surfaces of your object with an angle larger than this setting, won't have their top/bottom skin expanded. This avoids expanding the narrow skin areas that are created when the model surface has a near vertical slope. An angle of 0° is horizontal and will cause no skin to be expanded, while an angle of 90° is vertical and will cause all skin to be expanded.

availableParameters.name: min_skin_width_for_expansion
availableParameters.title: Minimum Skin Width for Expansion
availableParameters.description: Skin areas narrower than this are not expanded. This avoids expanding the narrow skin areas that are created when the model surface has a slope close to the vertical.

availableParameters.name: infill_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Infill Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train used for printing infill. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: infill_sparse_density
availableParameters.title: Infill Density
availableParameters.description: Adjusts the density of infill of the print.

availableParameters.name: infill_line_distance
availableParameters.title: Infill Line Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance between the printed infill lines. This setting is calculated by the infill density and the infill line width.

defaultValue.expression: infill_sparse_density == 0 ? 0 : (infill_line_width * 100) / infill_sparse_density * (2 if infill_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if infill_pattern == 'triangles' || infill_pattern == 'trihexagon' || infill_pattern == 'cubic' || infill_pattern == 'cubicsubdiv' else (2 if infill_pattern == 'tetrahedral' || infill_pattern == 'quarter_cubic' else (1 if infill_pattern == 'cross' || infill_pattern == 'cross_3d' else (1.6 if infill_pattern == 'lightning' else 1)))))

availableParameters.name: infill_pattern
availableParameters.title: Infill Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern of the infill material of the print. The line and zig zag infill swap direction on alternate layers, reducing material cost. The grid, triangle, tri-hexagon, cubic, octet, quarter cubic, cross and concentric patterns are fully printed every layer. Gyroid, cubic, quarter cubic and octet infill change with every layer to provide a more equal distribution of strength over each direction. Lightning infill tries to minimize the infill, by only supporting the ceiling of the object.

availableParameters.name: zig_zaggify_infill
availableParameters.title: Connect Infill Lines
availableParameters.description: Connect the ends where the infill pattern meets the inner wall using a line which follows the shape of the inner wall. Enabling this setting can make the infill adhere to the walls better and reduce the effects of infill on the quality of vertical surfaces. Disabling this setting reduces the amount of material used.

enabledCondition.expression: infill_pattern == 'lines' || infill_pattern == 'grid' || infill_pattern == 'triangles' || infill_pattern == 'trihexagon' || infill_pattern == 'cubic' || infill_pattern == 'tetrahedral' || infill_pattern == 'quarter_cubic' || infill_pattern == 'cross' || infill_pattern == 'cross_3d' || infill_pattern == 'gyroid'

availableParameters.name: connect_infill_polygons
availableParameters.title: Connect Infill Polygons
availableParameters.description: Connect infill paths where they run next to each other. For infill patterns which consist of several closed polygons, enabling this setting greatly reduces the travel time.

enabledCondition.expression: infill_pattern != 'lightning' && infill_pattern == 'cross' || infill_pattern == 'cross_3d' || infill_pattern == 'concentric' || infill_multiplier % 2 == 0 || infill_wall_line_count > 1

availableParameters.name: infill_angles
availableParameters.title: Infill Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the traditional default angles (45 and 135 degrees for the lines and zig zag patterns and 45 degrees for all other patterns).

availableParameters.name: infill_offset_x
availableParameters.title: Infill X Offset
availableParameters.description: The infill pattern is moved this distance along the X axis.

enabledCondition.expression: infill_pattern != 'lightning' && infill_pattern == 'grid' || infill_pattern == 'lines' || infill_pattern == 'triangles' || infill_pattern == 'cubic' || infill_pattern == 'tetrahedral' || infill_pattern == 'quarter_cubic' || infill_pattern == 'zigzag'

availableParameters.name: infill_offset_y
availableParameters.title: Infill Y Offset
availableParameters.description: The infill pattern is moved this distance along the Y axis.

enabledCondition.expression: infill_pattern != 'lightning' && infill_pattern == 'grid' || infill_pattern == 'lines' || infill_pattern == 'triangles' || infill_pattern == 'cubic' || infill_pattern == 'tetrahedral' || infill_pattern == 'quarter_cubic' || infill_pattern == 'zigzag'

availableParameters.name: infill_randomize_start_location
availableParameters.title: Randomize Infill Start
availableParameters.description: Randomize which infill line is printed first. This prevents one segment becoming the strongest, but it does so at the cost of an additional travel move.

availableParameters.name: infill_multiplier
availableParameters.title: Infill Line Multiplier
availableParameters.description: Convert each infill line to this many lines. The extra lines do not cross over each other, but avoid each other. This makes the infill stiffer, but increases print time and material usage.

availableParameters.name: infill_wall_line_count
availableParameters.title: Extra Infill Wall Count
availableParameters.description:
Add extra walls around the infill area. Such walls can make top/bottom skin lines sag down less which means you need less top/bottom skin layers for the same quality at the cost of some extra material.
This feature can combine with the Connect Infill Polygons to connect all the infill into a single extrusion path without the need for travels or retractions if configured right.

availableParameters.name: sub_div_rad_add
availableParameters.title: Cubic Subdivision Shell
availableParameters.description: An addition to the radius from the center of each cube to check for the boundary of the model, as to decide whether this cube should be subdivided. Larger values lead to a thicker shell of small cubes near the boundary of the model.

availableParameters.name: infill_overlap
availableParameters.title: Infill Overlap Percentage
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

availableParameters.name: infill_overlap_mm
availableParameters.title: Infill Overlap
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

defaultValue.expression: wall_line_count > 1 ? 0.5 * (infill_line_width + (wall_line_width_x : wall_line_width_0)) * infill_overlap / 100 if infill_sparse_density < 95 && infill_pattern != 'concentric' else 0

availableParameters.name: infill_wipe_dist
availableParameters.title: Infill Wipe Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance of a travel move inserted after every infill line, to make the infill stick to the walls better. This option is similar to infill overlap, but without extrusion and only on one end of the infill line.

availableParameters.name: infill_sparse_thickness
availableParameters.title: Infill Layer Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness per layer of infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.

availableParameters.name: gradual_infill_steps
availableParameters.title: Gradual Infill Steps
availableParameters.description: Number of times to reduce the infill density by half when getting further below top surfaces. Areas which are closer to top surfaces get a higher density, up to the Infill Density.

availableParameters.name: gradual_infill_step_height
availableParameters.title: Gradual Infill Step Height
availableParameters.description: The height of infill of a given density before switching to half the density.

availableParameters.name: infill_before_walls
availableParameters.title: Infill Before Walls
availableParameters.description: Print the infill before printing the walls. Printing the walls first may lead to more accurate walls, but overhangs print worse. Printing the infill first leads to sturdier walls, but the infill pattern might sometimes show through the surface.

availableParameters.name: min_infill_area
availableParameters.title: Minimum Infill Area
availableParameters.description: Don't generate areas of infill smaller than this (use skin instead).

availableParameters.name: infill_support_enabled
availableParameters.title: Infill Support
availableParameters.description: Print infill structures only where tops of the model should be supported. Enabling this reduces print time and material usage, but leads to ununiform object strength.

availableParameters.name: infill_support_angle
availableParameters.title: Infill Overhang Angle
availableParameters.description: The minimum angle of internal overhangs for which infill is added. At a value of 0° objects are totally filled with infill, 90° will not provide any infill.

availableParameters.name: skin_support
availableParameters.title: Infill Skin Support
availableParameters.description: Print a solid infill pattern just below skin to avoid printing the skin over air.

availableParameters.name: skin_support_speed
availableParameters.title: Skin Support Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which skin support regions are printed.

availableParameters.name: skin_support_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Skin Support Flow
availableParameters.description: When printing skin support regions, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

availableParameters.name: skin_support_density
availableParameters.title: Skin Support Density
availableParameters.description: The density of the skin support layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the lines.

availableParameters.name: skin_support_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Skin Support Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: Percentage fan speed to use when printing skin support.

availableParameters.name: skin_support_interlace_lines
availableParameters.title: Interlace Skin Support Lines
availableParameters.description: When enabled, skin support lines will be printed interlaced, i.e. in 2 monotonic passes so that adjacent lines won't be printed just after each other. The lines of the first pass then have more time to cool down and are stronger when the second pass is added.

availableParameters.name: lightning_infill_support_angle
availableParameters.title: Lightning Infill Support Angle
availableParameters.description: Determines when a lightning infill layer has to support anything above it. Measured in the angle given the thickness of a layer.

availableParameters.name: lightning_infill_overhang_angle
availableParameters.title: Lightning Infill Overhang Angle
availableParameters.description: Determines when a lightning infill layer has to support the model above it. Measured in the angle given the thickness.

availableParameters.name: lightning_infill_prune_angle
availableParameters.title: Lightning Infill Prune Angle
availableParameters.description: The endpoints of infill lines are shortened to save on material. This setting is the angle of overhang of the endpoints of these lines.

availableParameters.name: lightning_infill_straightening_angle
availableParameters.title: Lightning Infill Straightening Angle
availableParameters.description: The infill lines are straightened out to save on printing time. This is the maximum angle of overhang allowed across the length of the infill line.

availableParameters.name: infill_move_inwards_length
availableParameters.title: Infill Start/End Move Inwards Length
availableParameters.description: When starting or ending infill print, add an inwards extrusion move so that the tips of the infill won't impact the outer wall. This can be useful when the infill is printed at very high speed.

availableParameters.name: infill_start_move_inwards_length
availableParameters.title: Infill Start Move Inwards Length
availableParameters.description: When starting infill print, add an inwards extrusion move so that the tips of the infill won't impact the outer wall. This can be useful when the infill is printed at very high speed.

availableParameters.name: infill_end_move_inwards_length
availableParameters.title: Infill End Move Inwards Length
availableParameters.description: When starting or ending infill print, add an inwards extrusion move so that the tips of the infill won't impact the outer wall. This can be useful when the infill is printed at very high speed.

availableParameters.name: default_material_print_temperature
availableParameters.title: Default Printing Temperature
availableParameters.description: The default temperature used for printing. This should be the "base" temperature of a material. All other print temperatures should use offsets based on this value

availableParameters.name: build_volume_temperature
availableParameters.title: Build Volume Temperature
availableParameters.description: The temperature of the environment to print in. If this is 0, the build volume temperature will not be adjusted.

availableParameters.name: material_print_temperature
availableParameters.title: Printing Temperature
availableParameters.description: The temperature used for printing.

availableParameters.name: material_print_temperature_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Printing Temperature Initial Layer
availableParameters.description: The temperature used for printing the first layer.

availableParameters.name: material_initial_print_temperature
availableParameters.title: Initial Printing Temperature
availableParameters.description: The minimal temperature while heating up to the Printing Temperature at which printing can already start.

availableParameters.name: material_final_print_temperature
availableParameters.title: Final Printing Temperature
availableParameters.description: The temperature to which to already start cooling down just before the end of printing.

availableParameters.name: material_extrusion_cool_down_speed
availableParameters.title: Extrusion Cool Down Speed Modifier
availableParameters.description: The extra speed by which the nozzle cools while extruding. The same value is used to signify the heat up speed lost when heating up while extruding.

availableParameters.name: default_material_bed_temperature
availableParameters.title: Default Build Plate Temperature
availableParameters.description: The default temperature used for the heated build plate. This should be the "base" temperature of a build plate. All other print temperatures should use offsets based on this value

availableParameters.name: material_bed_temperature
availableParameters.title: Build Plate Temperature
availableParameters.description: The temperature used for the heated build plate. If this is 0, the build plate is left unheated.

availableParameters.name: material_bed_temperature_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Build Plate Temperature Initial Layer
availableParameters.description: The temperature used for the heated build plate at the first layer. If this is 0, the build plate is left unheated during the first layer.

availableParameters.name: material_adhesion_tendency
availableParameters.title: Adhesion Tendency
availableParameters.description: Surface adhesion tendency.

availableParameters.name: material_surface_energy
availableParameters.title: Surface Energy
availableParameters.description: Surface energy.

availableParameters.name: material_shrinkage_percentage
availableParameters.title: Scaling Factor Shrinkage Compensation
availableParameters.description: To compensate for the shrinkage of the material as it cools down, the model will be scaled with this factor.

availableParameters.name: material_shrinkage_percentage_xy
availableParameters.title: Horizontal Scaling Factor Shrinkage Compensation
availableParameters.description: To compensate for the shrinkage of the material as it cools down, the model will be scaled with this factor in the XY-direction (horizontally).

availableParameters.name: material_shrinkage_percentage_z
availableParameters.title: Vertical Scaling Factor Shrinkage Compensation
availableParameters.description: To compensate for the shrinkage of the material as it cools down, the model will be scaled with this factor in the Z-direction (vertically).

availableParameters.name: material_crystallinity
availableParameters.title: Crystalline Material
availableParameters.description: Is this material the type that breaks off cleanly when heated (crystalline), or is it the type that produces long intertwined polymer chains (non-crystalline)?

availableParameters.name: material_anti_ooze_retracted_position
availableParameters.title: Anti-ooze Retracted Position
availableParameters.description: How far the material needs to be retracted before it stops oozing.

availableParameters.name: material_anti_ooze_retraction_speed
availableParameters.title: Anti-ooze Retraction Speed
availableParameters.description: How fast the material needs to be retracted during a filament switch to prevent oozing.

availableParameters.name: material_break_preparation_retracted_position
availableParameters.title: Break Preparation Retracted Position
availableParameters.description: How far the filament can be stretched before it breaks, while heated.

availableParameters.name: material_break_preparation_speed
availableParameters.title: Break Preparation Retraction Speed
availableParameters.description: How fast the filament needs to be retracted just before breaking it off in a retraction.

availableParameters.name: material_break_preparation_temperature
availableParameters.title: Break Preparation Temperature
availableParameters.description: The temperature used to purge material, should be roughly equal to the highest possible printing temperature.

availableParameters.name: material_break_retracted_position
availableParameters.title: Break Retracted Position
availableParameters.description: How far to retract the filament in order to break it cleanly.

availableParameters.name: material_break_speed
availableParameters.title: Break Retraction Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which to retract the filament in order to break it cleanly.

availableParameters.name: material_break_temperature
availableParameters.title: Break Temperature
availableParameters.description: The temperature at which the filament is broken for a clean break.

availableParameters.name: material_flush_purge_speed
availableParameters.title: Flush Purge Speed
availableParameters.description: How fast to prime the material after switching to a different material.

availableParameters.name: material_flush_purge_length
availableParameters.title: Flush Purge Length
availableParameters.description: How much material to use to purge the previous material out of the nozzle (in length of filament) when switching to a different material.

availableParameters.name: material_end_of_filament_purge_speed
availableParameters.title: End of Filament Purge Speed
availableParameters.description: How fast to prime the material after replacing an empty spool with a fresh spool of the same material.

availableParameters.name: material_end_of_filament_purge_length
availableParameters.title: End of Filament Purge Length
availableParameters.description: How much material to use to purge the previous material out of the nozzle (in length of filament) when replacing an empty spool with a fresh spool of the same material.

availableParameters.name: material_maximum_park_duration
availableParameters.title: Maximum Park Duration
availableParameters.description: How long the material can be kept out of dry storage safely.

availableParameters.name: material_no_load_move_factor
availableParameters.title: No Load Move Factor
availableParameters.description: A factor indicating how much the filament gets compressed between the feeder and the nozzle chamber, used to determine how far to move the material for a filament switch.

availableParameters.name: material_flow
availableParameters.title: Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation: the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

availableParameters.name: wall_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Wall Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on wall lines.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on the outermost wall line.

availableParameters.name: wall_x_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Inner Wall(s) Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on wall lines for all wall lines except the outermost one.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_material_flow_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Outer Wall Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on the top surface outermost wall line.

availableParameters.name: wall_x_material_flow_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Inner Wall(s) Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on top surface wall lines for all wall lines except the outermost one.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_material_flow_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Outer Wall Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on the bottom surface outermost wall line.

availableParameters.name: wall_x_material_flow_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Inner Wall(s) Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on bottom surface wall lines for all wall lines except the outermost one.

availableParameters.name: skin_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on top/bottom lines.

availableParameters.name: roofing_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on lines of the areas at the top of the print.

availableParameters.name: flooring_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on lines of the areas at the bottom of the print.

availableParameters.name: infill_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Infill Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on infill lines.

availableParameters.name: skirt_brim_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Skirt/Brim Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on skirt or brim lines.

availableParameters.name: support_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Support Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on support structure lines.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on lines of support roof or floor.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on support roof lines.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on support floor lines.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_flow
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on prime tower lines.

availableParameters.name: material_flow_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation for the first layer: the amount of material extruded on the initial layer is multiplied by this value.

availableParameters.name: wall_x_material_flow_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Inner Wall Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on wall lines for all wall lines except the outermost one, but only for the first layer

availableParameters.name: wall_0_material_flow_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Outer Wall Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on the outermost wall line of the first layer.

availableParameters.name: skin_material_flow_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Bottom Flow
availableParameters.description: Flow compensation on bottom lines of the first layer

availableParameters.name: material_standby_temperature
availableParameters.title: Standby Temperature
availableParameters.description: The temperature of the nozzle when another nozzle is currently used for printing.

availableParameters.name: material_is_support_material
availableParameters.title: Is support material
availableParameters.description: Is this material typically used as a support material during printing.

availableParameters.name: gradual_flow_enabled
availableParameters.title: Gradual flow enabled
availableParameters.description: Enable gradual flow changes. When enabled, the flow is gradually increased/decreased to the target flow. This is useful for printers with a bowden tube where the flow is not immediately changed when the extruder motor starts/stops.

availableParameters.name: max_flow_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Gradual flow max acceleration
availableParameters.description: Maximum acceleration for gradual flow changes

availableParameters.name: layer_0_max_flow_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Initial layer max flow acceleration
availableParameters.description: Minimum speed for gradual flow changes for the first layer

availableParameters.name: gradual_flow_discretisation_step_size
availableParameters.title: Gradual flow discretisation step size
availableParameters.description: Duration of each step in the gradual flow change

availableParameters.name: material_pressure_advance_factor
availableParameters.title: Pressure advance factor
availableParameters.description: Tuning factor for pressure advance, which is meant to synchronize extrusion with motion

availableParameters.name: material_max_flowrate
availableParameters.title: Material Maximum Flow Rate
availableParameters.description: Maximum flow rate that the printer can extrude for the material

availableParameters.name: speed_print
availableParameters.title: Print Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which printing happens.

availableParameters.name: speed_infill
availableParameters.title: Infill Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which infill is printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_wall
availableParameters.title: Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_wall_0
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the outermost walls are printed. Printing the outer wall at a lower speed improves the final skin quality. However, having a large difference between the inner wall speed and the outer wall speed will affect quality in a negative way.

availableParameters.name: speed_wall_x
availableParameters.title: Inner Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which all inner walls are printed. Printing the inner wall faster than the outer wall will reduce printing time. It works well to set this in between the outer wall speed and the infill speed.

availableParameters.name: speed_wall_0_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Outer Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the top surface outermost wall is printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_wall_x_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Inner Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the top surface inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_wall_0_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Outer Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the bottom surface outermost wall is printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_wall_x_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Inner Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the bottom surface inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which top surface skin layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which bottom surface skin layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_topbottom
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which top/bottom layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: speed_support
availableParameters.title: Support Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the support structure is printed. Printing support at higher speeds can greatly reduce printing time. The surface quality of the support structure is not important since it is removed after printing.

availableParameters.name: speed_support_infill
availableParameters.title: Support Infill Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the infill of support is printed. Printing the infill at lower speeds improves stability.

availableParameters.name: speed_support_interface
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.

availableParameters.name: speed_support_roof
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower speeds can improve overhang quality.

availableParameters.name: speed_support_bottom
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the floor of support is printed. Printing it at lower speed can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.

availableParameters.name: speed_prime_tower
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the prime tower is printed. Printing the prime tower slower can make it more stable when the adhesion between the different filaments is suboptimal.

availableParameters.name: speed_travel
availableParameters.title: Travel Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which travel moves are made.

availableParameters.name: speed_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate. Does not affect the build plate adhesion structures themselves, like brim and raft.

availableParameters.name: speed_print_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Print Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed of printing for the initial layer. A lower value is advised to improve adhesion to the build plate.

availableParameters.name: speed_travel_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Travel Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed of travel moves in the initial layer. A lower value is advised to prevent pulling previously printed parts away from the build plate. The value of this setting can automatically be calculated from the ratio between the Travel Speed and the Print Speed.

availableParameters.name: skirt_brim_speed
availableParameters.title: Skirt/Brim Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done at the initial layer speed, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different speed.

availableParameters.name: speed_z_hop
availableParameters.title: Z Hop Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the vertical Z movement is made for Z Hops. This is typically lower than the print speed since the build plate or machine's gantry is harder to move.

availableParameters.name: speed_slowdown_layers
availableParameters.title: Number of Slower Layers
availableParameters.description: The first few layers are printed slower than the rest of the model, to get better adhesion to the build plate and improve the overall success rate of prints. The speed is gradually increased over these layers.

availableParameters.name: speed_equalize_flow_width_factor
availableParameters.title: Flow Equalization Ratio
availableParameters.description: Extrusion width based correction factor on the speed. At 0% the movement speed is kept constant at the Print Speed. At 100% the movement speed is adjusted so that the flow (in mm³/s) is kept constant, i.e. lines half the normal Line Width are printed twice as fast and lines twice as wide are printed half as fast. A value larger than 100% can help to compensate for the higher pressure required to extrude wide lines.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Acceleration Control
availableParameters.description: Enables adjusting the print head acceleration. Increasing the accelerations can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_travel_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Travel Acceleration
