availableParameters.description: Use a separate acceleration rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the acceleration value of the printed line at their destination.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_print
availableParameters.title: Print Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which printing happens.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_infill
availableParameters.title: Infill Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which infill is printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_wall
availableParameters.title: Wall Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_wall_0
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the outermost walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_wall_x
availableParameters.title: Inner Wall Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which all inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_wall_0_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Outer Wall Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the top surface outermost walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_wall_x_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Inner Wall Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the top surface inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_wall_0_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Outer Wall Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the bottom surface outermost walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_wall_x_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Inner Wall Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the bottom surface inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which top surface skin layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which bottom surface skin layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_topbottom
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which top/bottom layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_support
availableParameters.title: Support Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the support structure is printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_support_infill
availableParameters.title: Support Infill Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the infill of support is printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_support_interface
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the roofs and floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_support_roof
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the roofs of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve overhang quality.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_support_bottom
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the floors of support are printed. Printing them at lower acceleration can improve adhesion of support on top of your model.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_prime_tower
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the prime tower is printed.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_travel
availableParameters.title: Travel Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which travel moves are made.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration for the initial layer.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_print_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Print Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration during the printing of the initial layer.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_travel_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Travel Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.

availableParameters.name: acceleration_skirt_brim
availableParameters.title: Skirt/Brim Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the skirt and brim are printed. Normally this is done with the initial layer acceleration, but sometimes you might want to print the skirt or brim at a different acceleration.

availableParameters.name: jerk_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Jerk Control
availableParameters.description: Enables adjusting the jerk of print head when the velocity in the X or Y axis changes. Increasing the jerk can reduce printing time at the cost of print quality.

availableParameters.name: jerk_travel_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Travel Jerk
availableParameters.description: Use a separate jerk rate for travel moves. If disabled, travel moves will use the jerk value of the printed line at their destination.

availableParameters.name: jerk_print
availableParameters.title: Print Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change of the print head.

availableParameters.name: jerk_infill
availableParameters.title: Infill Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which infill is printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_wall
availableParameters.title: Wall Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_wall_0
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the outermost walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_wall_x
availableParameters.title: Inner Wall Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which all inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_wall_0_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Outer Wall Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the top surface outermost walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_wall_x_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Inner Wall Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the top surface inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_wall_0_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Outer Wall Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the bottom surface outermost walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_wall_x_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Inner Wall Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the bottom surface inner walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_roofing
availableParameters.title: Top Surface Skin Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top surface skin layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_flooring
availableParameters.title: Bottom Surface Skin Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which bottom surface skin layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_topbottom
availableParameters.title: Top/Bottom Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which top/bottom layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_support
availableParameters.title: Support Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the support structure is printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_support_infill
availableParameters.title: Support Infill Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the infill of support is printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_support_interface
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs and floors of support are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_support_roof
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the roofs of support are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_support_bottom
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the floors of support are printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_prime_tower
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the prime tower is printed.

availableParameters.name: jerk_travel
availableParameters.title: Travel Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which travel moves are made.

availableParameters.name: jerk_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Jerk
availableParameters.description: The print maximum instantaneous velocity change for the initial layer.

availableParameters.name: jerk_print_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Print Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change during the printing of the initial layer.

availableParameters.name: jerk_travel_layer_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Travel Jerk
availableParameters.description: The acceleration for travel moves in the initial layer.

availableParameters.name: jerk_skirt_brim
availableParameters.title: Skirt/Brim Jerk
availableParameters.description: The maximum instantaneous velocity change with which the skirt and brim are printed.

availableParameters.name: retraction_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Retraction
availableParameters.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving over a non-printed area.

availableParameters.name: retract_at_layer_change
availableParameters.title: Retract at Layer Change
availableParameters.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving to the next layer.

availableParameters.name: retraction_amount
availableParameters.title: Retraction Distance
availableParameters.description: The length of material retracted during a retraction move.

availableParameters.name: retraction_speed
availableParameters.title: Retraction Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted and primed during a retraction move.

availableParameters.name: retraction_retract_speed
availableParameters.title: Retraction Retract Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted during a retraction move.

availableParameters.name: retraction_prime_speed
availableParameters.title: Retraction Prime Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is primed during a retraction move.

availableParameters.name: retraction_extra_prime_amount
availableParameters.title: Retraction Extra Prime Amount
availableParameters.description: Some material can ooze away during a travel move, which can be compensated for here.

availableParameters.name: retraction_min_travel
availableParameters.title: Retraction Minimum Travel
availableParameters.description: The minimum distance of travel needed for a retraction to happen at all. This helps to get fewer retractions in a small area.

availableParameters.name: retraction_count_max
availableParameters.title: Maximum Retraction Count
availableParameters.description: This setting limits the number of retractions occurring within the minimum extrusion distance window. Further retractions within this window will be ignored. This avoids retracting repeatedly on the same piece of filament, as that can flatten the filament and cause grinding issues.

availableParameters.name: retraction_extrusion_window
availableParameters.title: Minimum Extrusion Distance Window
availableParameters.description: The window in which the maximum retraction count is enforced. This value should be approximately the same as the retraction distance, so that effectively the number of times a retraction passes the same patch of material is limited.

availableParameters.name: retraction_combing
availableParameters.title: Combing Mode
availableParameters.description: Combing keeps the nozzle within already printed areas when traveling. This results in slightly longer travel moves but reduces the need for retractions. If combing is off, the material will retract and the nozzle moves in a straight line to the next point. It is also possible to avoid combing over top/bottom skin areas or to only comb within the infill.

availableParameters.name: retraction_combing_max_distance
availableParameters.title: Max Comb Distance With No Retract
availableParameters.description: When greater than zero, combing travel moves that are longer than this distance will use retraction. If set to zero, there is no maximum and combing moves will not use retraction.

availableParameters.name: retraction_combing_avoid_distance
availableParameters.title: Inside Travel Avoid Distance
availableParameters.description: The distance between the nozzle and already printed outer walls when travelling inside a model.

availableParameters.name: travel_retract_before_outer_wall
availableParameters.title: Retract Before Outer Wall
availableParameters.description: Always retract when moving to start an outer wall.

availableParameters.name: travel_avoid_other_parts
availableParameters.title: Avoid Printed Parts When Traveling
availableParameters.description: The nozzle avoids already printed parts when traveling. This option is only available when combing is enabled.

availableParameters.name: travel_avoid_supports
availableParameters.title: Avoid Supports When Traveling
availableParameters.description: The nozzle avoids already printed supports when traveling. This option is only available when combing is enabled.

availableParameters.name: travel_avoid_distance
availableParameters.title: Travel Avoid Distance
availableParameters.description: The distance between the nozzle and already printed parts when avoiding during travel moves.

availableParameters.name: layer_start_x
availableParameters.title: Layer Start X
availableParameters.description: The X coordinate of the position near where to find the part to start printing each layer.

availableParameters.name: layer_start_y
availableParameters.title: Layer Start Y
availableParameters.description: The Y coordinate of the position near where to find the part to start printing each layer.

availableParameters.name: retraction_hop_enabled
availableParameters.title: Z Hop When Retracted
availableParameters.description: Whenever a retraction is done, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. It prevents the nozzle from hitting the print during travel moves, reducing the chance to knock the print from the build plate.

availableParameters.name: retraction_hop_only_when_collides
availableParameters.title: Z Hop Only Over Printed Parts
availableParameters.description: Only perform a Z Hop when moving over printed parts which cannot be avoided by horizontal motion by Avoid Printed Parts when Traveling.

availableParameters.name: retraction_hop
availableParameters.title: Z Hop Height
availableParameters.description: The height difference when performing a Z Hop.

availableParameters.name: retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch
availableParameters.title: Z Hop After Extruder Switch
availableParameters.description: After the machine switched from one extruder to the other, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. This prevents the nozzle from leaving oozed material on the outside of a print.

availableParameters.name: retraction_hop_after_extruder_switch_height
availableParameters.title: Z Hop After Extruder Switch Height
availableParameters.description: The height difference when performing a Z Hop after extruder switch.

availableParameters.name: cool_fan_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Print Cooling
availableParameters.description: Enables the print cooling fans while printing. The fans improve print quality on layers with short layer times and bridging / overhangs.

availableParameters.name: build_fan_full_at_height
availableParameters.title: Build Volume Fan Speed at Height
availableParameters.description: The height at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. At the layers below the fan speed gradually increases from Initial Fan Speed to Regular Fan Speed.

availableParameters.name: build_fan_full_layer
availableParameters.title: Build Volume Fan Speed at Layer
availableParameters.description: The layer at which the build-volume fans spin on full fan speed. This value is calculated and rounded to a whole number.

availableParameters.name: build_volume_fan_speed_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Layers Build Volume Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The fan speed (as a percentage) for the auxiliary or build-volume fan, that is set until the layer specified at 'Build Volume Fan Speed at Layer' is reached. After that, the speed is set by 'Build Volume Fan Speed' instead (so not this 'Initial Layers' one).

availableParameters.name: build_volume_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Build Volume Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The fan speed (as a percentage) for the auxiliary or build-volume fan, that is set from the moment that the layer specified at 'Build Volume Fan Speed at Layer' is reached and onwards. Before that, the speed is set by 'Initial Layers Build Volume Fan Speed' instead.

availableParameters.name: cool_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the print cooling fans spin.

availableParameters.name: cool_fan_speed_min
availableParameters.title: Regular Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the fans spin before hitting the threshold. When a layer prints faster than the threshold, the fan speed gradually inclines towards the maximum fan speed.

availableParameters.name: cool_fan_speed_max
availableParameters.title: Maximum Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the fans spin on the minimum layer time. The fan speed gradually increases between the regular fan speed and maximum fan speed when the threshold is hit.

availableParameters.name: cool_min_layer_time_fan_speed_max
availableParameters.title: Regular/Maximum Fan Speed Threshold
availableParameters.description: The layer time which sets the threshold between regular fan speed and maximum fan speed. Layers that print slower than this time use regular fan speed. For faster layers the fan speed gradually increases towards the maximum fan speed.

availableParameters.name: cool_fan_speed_0
availableParameters.title: Initial Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the fans spin at the start of the print. In subsequent layers the fan speed is gradually increased up to the layer corresponding to Regular Fan Speed at Height.

availableParameters.name: cool_fan_full_at_height
availableParameters.title: Regular Fan Speed at Height
availableParameters.description: The height at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. At the layers below the fan speed gradually increases from Initial Fan Speed to Regular Fan Speed.

availableParameters.name: cool_fan_full_layer
availableParameters.title: Regular Fan Speed at Layer
availableParameters.description: The layer at which the fans spin on regular fan speed. If regular fan speed at height is set, this value is calculated and rounded to a whole number.

availableParameters.name: cool_min_layer_time
availableParameters.title: Minimum Layer Time
availableParameters.description: The minimum time spent in a layer. This forces the printer to slow down, to at least spend the time set here in one layer. This allows the printed material to cool down properly before printing the next layer. Layers may still take shorter than the minimal layer time if Lift Head is disabled and if the Minimum Speed would otherwise be violated.

availableParameters.name: cool_min_speed
availableParameters.title: Minimum Speed
availableParameters.description: The minimum print speed, despite slowing down due to the minimum layer time. When the printer would slow down too much, the pressure in the nozzle would be too low and result in bad print quality.

availableParameters.name: cool_lift_head
availableParameters.title: Lift Head
availableParameters.description: When the minimum speed is hit because of minimum layer time, lift the head away from the print and wait the extra time until the minimum layer time is reached.

availableParameters.name: cool_min_temperature
availableParameters.title: Small Layer Printing Temperature
availableParameters.description: Gradually reduce to this temperature when printing at reduced speeds because of minimum layer time.

availableParameters.name: cool_during_extruder_switch
availableParameters.title: Cooling during extruder switch
availableParameters.description: Whether to activate the cooling fans during a nozzle switch. This can help reducing oozing by cooling the nozzle faster:Unchanged: keep the fans as they were previouslyOnly last extruder: turn on the fan of the last used extruder, but turn the others off (if any). This is useful if you have completely separate extruders.All fans: turn on all fans during nozzle switch. This is useful if you have a single cooling fan, or multiple fans that stay close to each other.

availableParameters.name: support_enable
availableParameters.title: Generate Support
availableParameters.description: Generate structures to support parts of the model which have overhangs. Without these structures, such parts would collapse during printing.

availableParameters.name: support_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Support Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: support_infill_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Support Infill Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the infill of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: support_extruder_nr_layer_0
availableParameters.title: First Layer Support Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the first layer of support infill. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the roofs and floors of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the roofs of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the floors of the support. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: support_structure
availableParameters.title: Support Structure
availableParameters.description: Chooses between the techniques available to generate support. "Normal" support creates a support structure directly below the overhanging parts and drops those areas straight down. "Tree" support creates branches towards the overhanging areas that support the model on the tips of those branches, and allows the branches to crawl around the model to support it from the build plate as much as possible.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_angle
availableParameters.title: Maximum Branch Angle
availableParameters.description: The maximum angle of the branches while they grow around the model. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle to be able to have more reach.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_branch_diameter
availableParameters.title: Branch Diameter
availableParameters.description: The diameter of the thinnest branches of tree support. Thicker branches are more sturdy. Branches towards the base will be thicker than this.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_max_diameter
availableParameters.title: Trunk Diameter
availableParameters.description: The diameter of the widest branches of tree support. A thicker trunk is more sturdy; a thinner trunk takes up less space on the build plate.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_branch_diameter_angle
availableParameters.title: Branch Diameter Angle
availableParameters.description: The angle of the branches' diameter as they gradually become thicker towards the bottom. An angle of 0 will cause the branches to have uniform thickness over their length. A bit of an angle can increase stability of the tree support.

availableParameters.name: support_z_seam_away_from_model
availableParameters.title: Support Z Seam Away from Model
availableParameters.description: Manage the spatial relationship between the z seam of the support structure and the actual 3D model. This control is crucial as it allows users to ensure the seamless removal of support structures post-printing, without inflicting damage or leaving marks on the printed model.

availableParameters.name: support_z_seam_min_distance
availableParameters.title: Min Z Seam Distance from Model
availableParameters.description: The distance between the model and its support structure at the z-axis seam.

availableParameters.name: support_type
availableParameters.title: Support Placement
availableParameters.description: Adjusts the placement of the support structures. The placement can be set to touching build plate or everywhere. When set to everywhere the support structures will also be printed on the model.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_angle_slow
availableParameters.title: Preferred Branch Angle
availableParameters.description: The preferred angle of the branches, when they do not have to avoid the model. Use a lower angle to make them more vertical and more stable. Use a higher angle for branches to merge faster.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_max_diameter_increase_by_merges_when_support_to_model
availableParameters.title: Diameter Increase To Model
availableParameters.description: The most the diameter of a branch that has to connect to the model may increase by merging with branches that could reach the buildplate. Increasing this reduces print time, but increases the area of support that rests on model

availableParameters.name: support_tree_min_height_to_model
availableParameters.title: Minimum Height To Model
availableParameters.description: How tall a branch has to be if it is placed on the model. Prevents small blobs of support. This setting is ignored when a branch is supporting a support roof.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_bp_diameter
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Diameter
availableParameters.description: Diameter every branch tries to achieve when reaching the buildplate. Improves bed adhesion.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_top_rate
availableParameters.title: Branch Density
availableParameters.description: Adjusts the density of the support structure used to generate the tips of the branches. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove. Use Support Roof for very high values or ensure support density is similarly high at the top.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_tip_diameter
availableParameters.title: Tip Diameter
availableParameters.description: The diameter of the top of the tip of the branches of tree support.

availableParameters.name: support_tree_limit_branch_reach
availableParameters.title: Limit Branch Reach
availableParameters.description: Limit how far each branch should travel from the point it supports. This can make the support more sturdy, but will increase the amount of branches (and because of that material usage/print time)

availableParameters.name: support_tree_branch_reach_limit
availableParameters.title: Optimal Branch Range
availableParameters.description: A recomendation to how far branches can move from the points they support. Branches can violate this value to reach their destination (buildplate or a flat part of the model). Lowering this value will make the support more sturdy, but increase the amount of branches (and because of that material usage/print time)

availableParameters.name: support_tree_rest_preference
availableParameters.title: Rest Preference
availableParameters.description: The preferred placement of the support structures. If structures can't be placed at the preferred location, they will be place elsewhere, even if that means placing them on the model.

availableParameters.name: support_angle
availableParameters.title: Support Overhang Angle
availableParameters.description: The minimum angle of overhangs for which support is added. At a value of 0° all overhangs are supported, 90° will not provide any support.

availableParameters.name: support_pattern
availableParameters.title: Support Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern of the support structures of the print. The different options available result in sturdy or easy to remove support.

availableParameters.name: support_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Support Wall Line Count
availableParameters.description: The number of walls with which to surround support infill. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.

defaultValue.expression: support_enable && support_structure == 'tree' ? 1 : (1 if (support_pattern == 'grid' || support_pattern == 'triangles' || support_pattern == 'concentric') else 0)

availableParameters.name: support_interface_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Wall Line Count
availableParameters.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Wall Line Count
availableParameters.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface roof. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Support Bottom Wall Line Count
availableParameters.description: The number of walls with which to surround support interface floor. Adding a wall can make support print more reliably and can support overhangs better, but increases print time and material used.

availableParameters.name: zig_zaggify_support
availableParameters.title: Connect Support Lines
availableParameters.description: Connect the ends of the support lines together. Enabling this setting can make your support more sturdy and reduce underextrusion, but it will cost more material.

availableParameters.name: support_connect_zigzags
availableParameters.title: Connect Support ZigZags
availableParameters.description: Connect the ZigZags. This will increase the strength of the zig zag support structure.

availableParameters.name: support_infill_rate
availableParameters.title: Support Density
availableParameters.description: Adjusts the density of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

defaultValue.expression: support_enable && support_structure == 'normal' ? 15 : 0 if support_enable && support_structure == 'tree' else 15

availableParameters.name: support_line_distance
availableParameters.title: Support Line Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance between the printed support structure lines. This setting is calculated by the support density.

defaultValue.expression: support_infill_rate == 0 ? 0 : (support_line_width * 100) / support_infill_rate * (2 if support_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

availableParameters.name: support_initial_layer_line_distance
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Support Line Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance between the printed initial layer support structure lines. This setting is calculated by the support density.

availableParameters.name: support_infill_density_multiplier_initial_layer
availableParameters.title: Support Infill Density Multiplier Initial Layer
availableParameters.description: Multiplier for the infill on the initial layers of the support. Increasing this may help for bed adhesion.

availableParameters.name: support_infill_angles
availableParameters.title: Support Infill Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angle 0 degrees.

availableParameters.name: support_brim_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Support Brim
availableParameters.description: Generate a brim within the support infill regions of the first layer. This brim is printed underneath the support, not around it. Enabling this setting increases the adhesion of support to the build plate.

availableParameters.name: support_brim_width
availableParameters.title: Support Brim Width
availableParameters.description: The width of the brim to print underneath the support. A larger brim enhances adhesion to the build plate, at the cost of some extra material.

availableParameters.name: support_brim_line_count
availableParameters.title: Support Brim Line Count
availableParameters.description: The number of lines used for the support brim. More brim lines enhance adhesion to the build plate, at the cost of some extra material.

availableParameters.name: support_z_distance
availableParameters.title: Support Z Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance from the top/bottom of the support structure to the print. This gap provides clearance to remove the supports after the model is printed. The topmost support layer below the model might be a fraction of regular layers.

availableParameters.name: support_top_distance
availableParameters.title: Support Top Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance from the top of the support to the print.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_distance
availableParameters.title: Support Bottom Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance from the print to the bottom of the support. Note that this is rounded up to the next layer height.

availableParameters.name: support_xy_distance
availableParameters.title: Support X/Y Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance of the support structure from the print in the X/Y directions.

availableParameters.name: support_xy_overrides_z
availableParameters.title: Support Distance Priority
availableParameters.description: Whether the Support X/Y Distance overrides the Support Z Distance or vice versa. When X/Y overrides Z the X/Y distance can push away the support from the model, influencing the actual Z distance to the overhang. We can disable this by not applying the X/Y distance around overhangs.

availableParameters.name: support_xy_distance_overhang
availableParameters.title: Minimum Support X/Y Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance of the support structure from the overhang in the X/Y directions.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_stair_step_height
availableParameters.title: Support Stair Step Height
availableParameters.description: The height of the steps of the stair-like bottom of support resting on the model. A low value makes the support harder to remove, but too high values can lead to unstable support structures. Set to zero to turn off the stair-like behaviour.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_stair_step_width
availableParameters.title: Support Stair Step Maximum Width
availableParameters.description: The maximum width of the steps of the stair-like bottom of support resting on the model. A low value makes the support harder to remove, but too high values can lead to unstable support structures.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_stair_step_min_slope
availableParameters.title: Support Stair Step Minimum Slope Angle
availableParameters.description: The minimum slope of the area for stair-stepping to take effect. Low values should make support easier to remove on shallower slopes, but really low values may result in some very counter-intuitive results on other parts of the model.

availableParameters.name: support_join_distance
availableParameters.title: Support Join Distance
availableParameters.description: The maximum distance between support structures in the X/Y directions. When separate structures are closer together than this value, the structures merge into one.

availableParameters.name: support_offset
availableParameters.title: Support Horizontal Expansion
availableParameters.description: Amount of offset applied to all support polygons in each layer. Positive values can smooth out the support areas and result in more sturdy support.

availableParameters.name: support_infill_sparse_thickness
availableParameters.title: Support Infill Layer Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness per layer of support infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.

availableParameters.name: gradual_support_infill_steps
availableParameters.title: Gradual Support Infill Steps
availableParameters.description: Number of times to reduce the support infill density by half when getting further below top surfaces. Areas which are closer to top surfaces get a higher density, up to the Support Infill Density.

maxThreshold.expression: support_line_distance == 0 ? (999999 : (20 - Math.log(support_line_distance) / Math.log(2))) if support_structure != 'tree' else 0

availableParameters.name: gradual_support_infill_step_height
availableParameters.title: Gradual Support Infill Step Height
availableParameters.description: The height of support infill of a given density before switching to half the density.

availableParameters.name: minimum_support_area
availableParameters.title: Minimum Support Area
availableParameters.description: Minimum area size for support polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will not be generated.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Support Interface
availableParameters.description: Generate a dense interface between the model and the support. This will create a skin at the top of the support on which the model is printed and at the bottom of the support, where it rests on the model.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Support Roof
availableParameters.description: Generate a dense slab of material between the top of support and the model. This will create a skin between the model and support.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Support Floor
availableParameters.description: Generate a dense slab of material between the bottom of the support and the model. This will create a skin between the model and support.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_height
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness of the interface of the support where it touches with the model on the bottom or the top.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_height
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness of the support roofs. This controls the amount of dense layers at the top of the support on which the model rests.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_height
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Thickness
availableParameters.description: The thickness of the support floors. This controls the number of dense layers that are printed on top of places of a model on which support rests.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_density
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Density
availableParameters.description: Adjusts the density of the roofs and floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_density
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Density
availableParameters.description: The density of the roofs of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_line_distance
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Line Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance between the printed support roof lines. This setting is calculated by the Support Roof Density, but can be adjusted separately.

defaultValue.expression: support_roof_density == 0 ? 0 : (support_roof_line_width * 100) / support_roof_density * (2 if support_roof_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_roof_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_density
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Density
availableParameters.description: The density of the floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better adhesion of the support on top of the model.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_line_distance
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Line Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance between the printed support floor lines. This setting is calculated by the Support Floor Density, but can be adjusted separately.

defaultValue.expression: support_bottom_density == 0 ? 0 : (support_bottom_line_width * 100) / support_bottom_density * (2 if support_bottom_pattern == 'grid' else (3 if support_bottom_pattern == 'triangles' else 1))

availableParameters.name: support_interface_pattern
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern with which the interface of the support with the model is printed.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_pattern
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern with which the roofs of the support are printed.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_pattern
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Pattern
availableParameters.description: The pattern with which the floors of the support are printed.

availableParameters.name: minimum_interface_area
availableParameters.title: Minimum Support Interface Area
availableParameters.description: Minimum area size for support interface polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.

availableParameters.name: minimum_roof_area
availableParameters.title: Minimum Support Roof Area
availableParameters.description: Minimum area size for the roofs of the support. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.

availableParameters.name: minimum_bottom_area
availableParameters.title: Minimum Support Floor Area
availableParameters.description: Minimum area size for the floors of the support. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_offset
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Horizontal Expansion
availableParameters.description: Amount of offset applied to the support interface polygons.

availableParameters.name: support_roof_offset
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Horizontal Expansion
availableParameters.description: Amount of offset applied to the roofs of the support.

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_offset
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Horizontal Expansion
availableParameters.description: Amount of offset applied to the floors of the support.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_priority
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Priority
availableParameters.description: How support interface and support will interact when they overlap. Currently only implemented for support roof.

availableParameters.name: support_interface_angles
availableParameters.title: Support Interface Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).

availableParameters.name: support_roof_angles
availableParameters.title: Support Roof Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).

availableParameters.name: support_bottom_angles
availableParameters.title: Support Floor Line Directions
availableParameters.description: A list of integer line directions to use. Elements from the list are used sequentially as the layers progress and when the end of the list is reached, it starts at the beginning again. The list items are separated by commas and the whole list is contained in square brackets. Default is an empty list which means use the default angles (alternates between 45 and 135 degrees if interfaces are quite thick or 90 degrees).

availableParameters.name: support_fan_enable
availableParameters.title: Fan Speed Override
availableParameters.description: When enabled, the print cooling fan speed is altered for the skin regions immediately above the support.

availableParameters.name: support_supported_skin_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Supported Skin Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: Percentage fan speed to use when printing the skin regions immediately above the support. Using a high fan speed can make the support easier to remove.

availableParameters.name: support_use_towers
availableParameters.title: Use Towers
availableParameters.description: Use specialized towers to support tiny overhang areas. These towers have a larger diameter than the region they support. Near the overhang the towers' diameter decreases, forming a roof.

availableParameters.name: support_tower_diameter
availableParameters.title: Tower Diameter
availableParameters.description: The diameter of a special tower.

availableParameters.name: support_tower_maximum_supported_diameter
availableParameters.title: Maximum Tower-Supported Diameter
availableParameters.description: Maximum diameter in the X/Y directions of a small area which is to be supported by a specialized support tower.

availableParameters.name: support_tower_roof_angle
availableParameters.title: Tower Roof Angle
availableParameters.description: The angle of a rooftop of a tower. A higher value results in pointed tower roofs, a lower value results in flattened tower roofs.

availableParameters.name: support_mesh_drop_down
availableParameters.title: Drop Down Support Mesh
availableParameters.description: Make support everywhere below the support mesh, so that there's no overhang in the support mesh.

availableParameters.name: support_meshes_present
availableParameters.title: Scene Has Support Meshes
availableParameters.description: There are support meshes present in the scene. This setting is controlled by Cura.

availableParameters.name: prime_blob_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Prime Blob
availableParameters.description: Whether to prime the filament with a blob before printing. Turning this setting on will ensure that the extruder will have material ready at the nozzle before printing. Printing Brim or Skirt can act like priming too, in which case turning this setting off saves some time.

availableParameters.name: extruder_prime_pos_x
availableParameters.title: Extruder Prime X Position
availableParameters.description: The X coordinate of the position where the nozzle primes at the start of printing.

availableParameters.name: extruder_prime_pos_y
availableParameters.title: Extruder Prime Y Position
availableParameters.description: The Y coordinate of the position where the nozzle primes at the start of printing.

availableParameters.name: adhesion_type
availableParameters.title: Build Plate Adhesion Type
availableParameters.description: Different options that help to improve both priming your extrusion and adhesion to the build plate. Brim adds a single layer flat area around the base of your model to prevent warping. Raft adds a thick grid with a roof below the model. Skirt is a line printed around the model, but not connected to the model.

availableParameters.name: adhesion_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Build Plate Adhesion Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the skirt/brim/raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: skirt_brim_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Skirt/Brim Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the skirt or brim. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the first layer of the raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the middle layer of the raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_extruder_nr
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Extruder
availableParameters.description: The extruder train to use for printing the top layer(s) of the raft. This is used in multi-extrusion.

availableParameters.name: skirt_line_count
availableParameters.title: Skirt Line Count
availableParameters.description: Multiple skirt lines help to prime your extrusion better for small models. Setting this to 0 will disable the skirt.

availableParameters.name: skirt_height
availableParameters.title: Skirt Height
availableParameters.description: Printing the innermost skirt line with multiple layers makes it easy to remove the skirt.

availableParameters.name: skirt_gap
availableParameters.title: Skirt Distance
availableParameters.description:
The horizontal distance between the skirt and the first layer of the print.
This is the minimum distance. Multiple skirt lines will extend outwards from this distance.

availableParameters.name: skirt_brim_minimal_length
availableParameters.title: Skirt/Brim Minimum Length
availableParameters.description: The minimum length of the skirt or brim. If this length is not reached by all skirt or brim lines together, more skirt or brim lines will be added until the minimum length is reached. Note: If the line count is set to 0 this is ignored.

availableParameters.name: brim_width
availableParameters.title: Brim Width
availableParameters.description: The distance from the model to the outermost brim line. A larger brim enhances adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

availableParameters.name: brim_line_count
availableParameters.title: Brim Line Count
availableParameters.description: The number of lines used for a brim. More brim lines enhance adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

availableParameters.name: brim_gap
availableParameters.title: Brim Distance
availableParameters.description: The horizontal distance between the first brim line and the outline of the first layer of the print. A small gap can make the brim easier to remove while still providing the thermal benefits.

availableParameters.name: brim_replaces_support
availableParameters.title: Brim Replaces Support
availableParameters.description: Enforce brim to be printed around the model even if that space would otherwise be occupied by support. This replaces some regions of the first layer of support by brim regions.

availableParameters.name: brim_location
availableParameters.title: Brim Location
availableParameters.description: Print a brim on the outside of the model, inside, or both. Depending on the model, this helps reducing the amount of brim you need to remove afterwards, while ensuring a proper bed adhesion.

availableParameters.name: brim_inside_margin
availableParameters.title: Brim Avoid Margin
availableParameters.description: A brim around a model may touch an other model where you don't want it. This removes all brim within this distance from brimless models.

availableParameters.name: brim_smart_ordering
availableParameters.title: Smart Brim
availableParameters.description: Swap print order of the innermost and second innermost brim lines. This improves brim removal.

availableParameters.name: raft_margin
availableParameters.title: Raft Extra Margin
availableParameters.description: If the raft is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_margin
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Extra Margin
availableParameters.description: If the raft base is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_margin
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Extra Margin
availableParameters.description: If the raft middle is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_margin
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Extra Margin
availableParameters.description: If the raft top is enabled, this is the extra raft area around the model which is also given a raft. Increasing this margin will create a stronger raft while using more material and leaving less area for your print.

availableParameters.name: raft_remove_inside_corners
availableParameters.title: Remove Raft Inside Corners
availableParameters.description: Remove inside corners from the raft, causing the raft to become convex.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_remove_inside_corners
availableParameters.title: Remove Raft Base Inside Corners
availableParameters.description: Remove inside corners from the raft base, causing the raft to become convex.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_remove_inside_corners
availableParameters.title: Remove Raft Middle Inside Corners
availableParameters.description: Remove inside corners from the raft middle part, causing the raft to become convex.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_remove_inside_corners
availableParameters.title: Remove Raft Top Inside Corners
availableParameters.description: Remove inside corners from the raft top part, causing the raft to become convex.

availableParameters.name: raft_smoothing
availableParameters.title: Raft Smoothing
availableParameters.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_smoothing
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Smoothing
availableParameters.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft base outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_smoothing
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Smoothing
availableParameters.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft middle outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_smoothing
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Smoothing
availableParameters.description: This setting controls how much inner corners in the raft top outline are rounded. Inward corners are rounded to a semi circle with a radius equal to the value given here. This setting also removes holes in the raft outline which are smaller than such a circle.

availableParameters.name: raft_airgap
availableParameters.title: Raft Air Gap
availableParameters.description: The gap between the final raft layer and the first layer of the model. Only the first layer is raised by this amount to lower the bonding between the raft layer and the model. Makes it easier to peel off the raft.

availableParameters.name: layer_0_z_overlap
availableParameters.title: Initial Layer Z Overlap
availableParameters.description:
Make the first and second layer of the model overlap in the Z direction to compensate for the filament lost in the airgap. All models above the first model layer will be shifted down by this amount.
It may be noted that sometimes the second layer is printed below initial layer because of this setting. This is intended behavior

availableParameters.name: raft_base_thickness
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Thickness
availableParameters.description: Layer thickness of the base raft layer. This should be a thick layer which sticks firmly to the printer build plate.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_line_width
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of the lines in the base raft layer. These should be thick lines to assist in build plate adhesion.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_line_spacing
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Line Spacing
availableParameters.description: The distance between the raft lines for the base raft layer. Wide spacing makes for easy removal of the raft from the build plate.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_infill_overlap
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Infill Overlap Percentage
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft base, as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_infill_overlap_mm
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Infill Overlap
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft base. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_layers
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Layers
availableParameters.description: The number of layers between the base and the surface of the raft. These comprise the main thickness of the raft. Increasing this creates a thicker, sturdier raft.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_thickness
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Thickness
availableParameters.description: Layer thickness of the middle raft layer.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_line_width
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of the lines in the middle raft layer. Making the second layer extrude more causes the lines to stick to the build plate.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_line_spacing
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Spacing
availableParameters.description: The distance between the raft lines for the middle raft layer. The spacing of the middle should be quite wide, while being dense enough to support the top raft layers.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_z_offset
availableParameters.title: Raft Interface Z Offset
availableParameters.description: When printing the first layer of the raft interface, translate by this offset to customize the adhesion between base and interface. A negative offset should improve the adhesion.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_infill_overlap
availableParameters.title: Raft Interface Infill Overlap Percentage
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft interface, as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_infill_overlap_mm
availableParameters.title: Raft Interface Infill Overlap
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft interface. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_layers
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Layers
availableParameters.description: The number of top layers on top of the 2nd raft layer. These are fully filled layers that the model sits on. 2 layers result in a smoother top surface than 1.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_thickness
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Layer Thickness
availableParameters.description: Layer thickness of the top raft layers.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_line_width
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Line Width
availableParameters.description: Width of the lines in the top surface of the raft. These can be thin lines so that the top of the raft becomes smooth.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_line_spacing
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Spacing
availableParameters.description: The distance between the raft lines for the top raft layers. The spacing should be equal to the line width, so that the surface is solid.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_z_offset
availableParameters.title: Raft Surface Z Offset
availableParameters.description: When printing the first layer of the raft surface, translate by this offset to customize the adhesion between interface and surface. A negative offset should improve the adhesion.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_monotonic
availableParameters.title: Monotonic Raft Top Surface Order
availableParameters.description: Print raft top surface lines in an ordering that causes them to always overlap with adjacent lines in a single direction. This takes slightly more time to print, but makes the surface look more consistent, which is also visible on the model bottom surface.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_infill_overlap
availableParameters.title: Raft Surface Infill Overlap Percentage
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft surface, as a percentage of the infill line width. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_infill_overlap_mm
availableParameters.title: Raft Surface Infill Overlap
availableParameters.description: The amount of overlap between the infill and the walls of the raft surface. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the infill.

availableParameters.name: raft_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Raft Wall Count
availableParameters.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern of the raft.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Wall Count
availableParameters.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern in the base layer of the raft.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Wall Count
availableParameters.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern in the middle layers of the raft.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_wall_count
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Wall Count
availableParameters.description: The number of contours to print around the linear pattern in the top layers of the raft.

availableParameters.name: raft_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Print Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the raft is printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Print Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the base raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Print Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the middle raft layer is printed. This should be printed quite slowly, as the volume of material coming out of the nozzle is quite high.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Print Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the top raft layers are printed. These should be printed a bit slower, so that the nozzle can slowly smooth out adjacent surface lines.

availableParameters.name: raft_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Raft Print Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the raft is printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Print Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the base raft layer is printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Print Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the middle raft layer is printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Print Acceleration
availableParameters.description: The acceleration with which the top raft layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_jerk
availableParameters.title: Raft Print Jerk
availableParameters.description: The jerk with which the raft is printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_jerk
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Print Jerk
availableParameters.description: The jerk with which the base raft layer is printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_jerk
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Print Jerk
availableParameters.description: The jerk with which the middle raft layer is printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_jerk
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Print Jerk
availableParameters.description: The jerk with which the top raft layers are printed.

availableParameters.name: raft_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The fan speed for the raft.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The fan speed for the base raft layer.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Middle Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The fan speed for the middle raft layer.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Raft Top Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: The fan speed for the top raft layers.

availableParameters.name: raft_flow
availableParameters.title: Raft Flow
availableParameters.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

availableParameters.name: raft_base_flow
availableParameters.title: Raft Base Flow
availableParameters.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft base printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

availableParameters.name: raft_interface_flow
availableParameters.title: Raft Interface Flow
availableParameters.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft interface printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

availableParameters.name: raft_surface_flow
availableParameters.title: Raft Surface Flow
availableParameters.description: The amount of material, relative to a normal extrusion line, to extrude during raft surface printing. Having an increased flow may improve adhesion and raft structural strength.

availableParameters.name: machine_scan_first_layer
availableParameters.title: Scan the first layer
availableParameters.description: Whether to scan the first layer for layer adhesion problems.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Prime Tower
availableParameters.description: Print a tower next to the print which serves to prime the material after each nozzle switch.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_mode
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Type
availableParameters.description: How to generate the prime tower:Normal: create a bucket in which secondary materials are primedInterleaved: create a prime tower as sparse as possible. This will save time and filament, but is only possible if the used materials adhere to each other

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_size
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Size
availableParameters.description: The width of the prime tower.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_min_volume
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Minimum Volume
availableParameters.description: The minimum volume for each layer of the prime tower in order to purge enough material.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_max_bridging_distance
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Maximum Bridging Distance
availableParameters.description: The maximum length of the branches which may be printed over the air.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_min_shell_thickness
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Minimum Shell Thickness
availableParameters.description: The minimum thickness of the prime tower shell. You may increase it to make the prime tower stronger.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_position_x
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower X Position
availableParameters.description: The x coordinate of the position of the prime tower.

defaultValue.expression: machine_shape == 'elliptic' ? ((machine_width / 2 + prime_tower_size / 2) : (machine_width - (prime_tower_base_size if (adhesion_type == 'raft' || prime_tower_brim_enable) else 0) - Math.max(...max([travel_avoid_distance]) + Math.max(...[machine_nozzle_offset_x]) + Math.max(...[support_offset]) + (skirt_brim_line_width * skirt_line_count * initial_layer_line_width_factor / 100 + skirt_gap if adhesion_type == 'skirt' else 0) + (draft_shield_dist if draft_shield_enabled else 0), Math.max(map(abs, [machine_nozzle_offset_x])), 1))) - (machine_width / 2 if machine_center_is_zero else 0)

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_position_y
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Y Position
availableParameters.description: The y coordinate of the position of the prime tower.

defaultValue.expression: (adhesion_type == 'raft' || prime_tower_brim_enable) ? machine_depth - prime_tower_size - (prime_tower_base_size : 0) - Math.max(...max([travel_avoid_distance]) + Math.max(...[machine_nozzle_offset_y]) + Math.max(...[support_offset]) + (skirt_brim_line_width * skirt_line_count * initial_layer_line_width_factor / 100 + skirt_gap if adhesion_type == 'skirt' else 0) + (draft_shield_dist if draft_shield_enabled else 0), Math.max(map(abs, [machine_nozzle_offset_y])), 1) - (machine_depth / 2 if machine_center_is_zero else 0)

maxThreshold.expression: machine_center_is_zero ? (machine_depth / 2 - prime_tower_size : machine_depth - prime_tower_size) - (prime_tower_base_size if (adhesion_type == 'raft' || prime_tower_brim_enable) else 0)

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_wipe_enabled
availableParameters.title: Wipe Inactive Nozzle on Prime Tower
availableParameters.description: After printing the prime tower with one nozzle, wipe the oozed material from the other nozzle off on the prime tower.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_brim_enable
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Base
availableParameters.description: By enabling this setting, your prime-tower will get a brim, even if the model doesn't. If you want a sturdier base for a high tower, you can increase the base height.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_base_size
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Base Size
availableParameters.description: The width of the prime tower brim/base. A larger base enhances adhesion to the build plate, but also reduces the effective print area.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_base_height
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Base Height
availableParameters.description: The height of the prime tower base. Increasing this value will result in a more sturdy prime tower because the base will be wider. If this setting is too low, the prime tower will not have a sturdy base.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_base_curve_magnitude
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Base Slope
availableParameters.description: The magnitude factor used for the slope of the prime tower base. If you increase this value, the base will become slimmer. If you decrease it, the base will become thicker.

availableParameters.name: prime_tower_raft_base_line_spacing
availableParameters.title: Prime Tower Raft Line Spacing
availableParameters.description: The distance between the raft lines for the unique prime tower raft layer. Wide spacing makes for easy removal of the raft from the build plate.

availableParameters.name: ooze_shield_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Ooze Shield
availableParameters.description: Enable exterior ooze shield. This will create a shell around the model which is likely to wipe a second nozzle if it's at the same height as the first nozzle.

availableParameters.name: ooze_shield_angle
availableParameters.title: Ooze Shield Angle
availableParameters.description: The maximum angle a part in the ooze shield will have. With 0 degrees being vertical, and 90 degrees being horizontal. A smaller angle leads to less failed ooze shields, but more material.

availableParameters.name: ooze_shield_dist
availableParameters.title: Ooze Shield Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance of the ooze shield from the print, in the X/Y directions.

availableParameters.name: switch_extruder_retraction_amount
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Switch Retraction Distance
availableParameters.description: The amount of retraction when switching extruders. Set to 0 for no retraction at all. This should generally be the same as the length of the heat zone.

availableParameters.name: switch_extruder_retraction_speeds
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Switch Retraction Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted. A higher retraction speed works better, but a very high retraction speed can lead to filament grinding.

availableParameters.name: switch_extruder_retraction_speed
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Switch Retract Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted during a nozzle switch retract.

availableParameters.name: switch_extruder_prime_speed
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Switch Prime Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is pushed back after a nozzle switch retraction.

availableParameters.name: switch_extruder_extra_prime_amount
availableParameters.title: Nozzle Switch Extra Prime Amount
availableParameters.description: Extra material to prime after nozzle switching.

availableParameters.name: interlocking_enable
availableParameters.title: Generate Interlocking Structure
availableParameters.description: At the locations where models touch, generate an interlocking beam structure. This improves the adhesion between models, especially models printed in different materials.

availableParameters.name: interlocking_beam_width
availableParameters.title: Interlocking Beam Width
availableParameters.description: The width of the interlocking structure beams.

availableParameters.name: interlocking_orientation
availableParameters.title: Interlocking Structure Orientation
availableParameters.description: The height of the beams of the interlocking structure, measured in number of layers. Less layers is stronger, but more prone to defects.

availableParameters.name: interlocking_beam_layer_count
availableParameters.title: Interlocking Beam Layer Count
availableParameters.description: The height of the beams of the interlocking structure, measured in number of layers. Less layers is stronger, but more prone to defects.

availableParameters.name: interlocking_depth
availableParameters.title: Interlocking Depth
availableParameters.description: The distance from the boundary between models to generate interlocking structure, measured in cells. Too few cells will result in poor adhesion.

availableParameters.name: interlocking_boundary_avoidance
availableParameters.title: Interlocking Boundary Avoidance
availableParameters.description: The distance from the outside of a model where interlocking structures will not be generated, measured in cells.

availableParameters.name: multi_material_paint_resolution
availableParameters.title: Multi-material Precision
availableParameters.description: The precision of the details when generating multi-material shapes based on painting data. A lower precision will provide more details, but increase the slicing time and memory.

availableParameters.name: multi_material_paint_depth
availableParameters.title: Multi-material Depth
availableParameters.description: The depth of the painted details inside the model. A higher depth will provide a better interlocking, but increase slicing time and memory. Set a very high value to go as deep as possible. The actually calculated depth may vary.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_union_all
availableParameters.title: Union Overlapping Volumes
availableParameters.description: Ignore the internal geometry arising from overlapping volumes within a mesh and print the volumes as one. This may cause unintended internal cavities to disappear.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_union_all_remove_holes
availableParameters.title: Remove All Holes
availableParameters.description: Remove the holes in each layer and keep only the outside shape. This will ignore any invisible internal geometry. However, it also ignores layer holes which can be viewed from above or below.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_extensive_stitching
