availableParameters.title: Extensive Stitching
availableParameters.description: Extensive stitching tries to stitch up open holes in the mesh by closing the hole with touching polygons. This option can introduce a lot of processing time.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_keep_open_polygons
availableParameters.title: Keep Disconnected Faces
availableParameters.description: Normally Cura tries to stitch up small holes in the mesh and remove parts of a layer with big holes. Enabling this option keeps those parts which cannot be stitched. This option should be used as a last resort option when everything else fails to produce proper g-code.

availableParameters.name: multiple_mesh_overlap
availableParameters.title: Merged Meshes Overlap
availableParameters.description: Make meshes which are touching each other overlap a bit. This makes them bond together better.

availableParameters.name: carve_multiple_volumes
availableParameters.title: Remove Mesh Intersection
availableParameters.description: Remove areas where multiple meshes are overlapping with each other. This may be used if merged dual material objects overlap with each other.

availableParameters.name: alternate_carve_order
availableParameters.title: Alternate Mesh Removal
availableParameters.description: Switch to which mesh intersecting volumes will belong with every layer, so that the overlapping meshes become interwoven. Turning this setting off will cause one of the meshes to obtain all of the volume in the overlap, while it is removed from the other meshes.

availableParameters.name: remove_empty_first_layers
availableParameters.title: Remove Empty First Layers
availableParameters.description: Remove empty layers beneath the first printed layer if they are present. Disabling this setting can cause empty first layers if the Slicing Tolerance setting is set to Exclusive or Middle.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_maximum_resolution
availableParameters.title: Maximum Resolution
availableParameters.description: The minimum size of a line segment after slicing. If you increase this, the mesh will have a lower resolution. This may allow the printer to keep up with the speed it has to process g-code and will increase slice speed by removing details of the mesh that it can't process anyway.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_maximum_travel_resolution
availableParameters.title: Maximum Travel Resolution
availableParameters.description: The minimum size of a travel line segment after slicing. If you increase this, the travel moves will have less smooth corners. This may allow the printer to keep up with the speed it has to process g-code, but it may cause model avoidance to become less accurate.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_maximum_deviation
availableParameters.title: Maximum Deviation
availableParameters.description: The maximum deviation allowed when reducing the resolution for the Maximum Resolution setting. If you increase this, the print will be less accurate, but the g-code will be smaller. Maximum Deviation is a limit for Maximum Resolution, so if the two conflict the Maximum Deviation will always be held true.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_maximum_extrusion_area_deviation
availableParameters.title: Maximum Extrusion Area Deviation
availableParameters.description: The maximum extrusion area deviation allowed when removing intermediate points from a straight line. An intermediate point may serve as width-changing point in a long straight line. Therefore, if it is removed, it will cause the line to have a uniform width and, as a result, lose (or gain) a bit of extrusion area. If you increase this you may notice slight under- (or over-) extrusion in between straight parallel walls, as more intermediate width-changing points will be allowed to be removed. Your print will be less accurate, but the g-code will be smaller.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_fluid_motion_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Fluid Motion
availableParameters.description: When enabled tool paths are corrected for printers with smooth motion planners. Small movements that deviate from the general tool path direction are smoothed to improve fluid motions.

availableParameters.name: meshfix_fluid_motion_shift_distance
availableParameters.title: Fluid Motion Shift Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance points are shifted to smooth the path

availableParameters.name: meshfix_fluid_motion_small_distance
availableParameters.title: Fluid Motion Small Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance points are shifted to smooth the path

availableParameters.name: meshfix_fluid_motion_angle
availableParameters.title: Fluid Motion Angle
availableParameters.description: If a toolpath-segment deviates more than this angle from the general motion it is smoothed.

availableParameters.name: print_sequence
availableParameters.title: Print Sequence
availableParameters.description: Whether to print all models one layer at a time or to wait for one model to finish, before moving on to the next. One at a time mode is possible if a) only one extruder is enabled and b) all models are separated in such a way that the whole print head can move in between and all models are lower than the distance between the nozzle and the X/Y axes.

availableParameters.name: user_defined_print_order_enabled
availableParameters.title: Set Print Sequence Manually
availableParameters.description: Allows you to order the object list to manually set the print sequence. First object from the list will be printed first.

availableParameters.name: infill_mesh
availableParameters.title: Infill Mesh
availableParameters.description: Use this mesh to modify the infill of other meshes with which it overlaps. Replaces infill regions of other meshes with regions for this mesh. It's suggested to only print one Wall and no Top/Bottom Skin for this mesh.

availableParameters.name: infill_mesh_order
availableParameters.title: Mesh Processing Rank
availableParameters.description: Determines the priority of this mesh when considering multiple overlapping infill meshes. Areas where multiple infill meshes overlap will take on the settings of the mesh with the highest rank. An infill mesh with a higher rank will modify the infill of infill meshes with lower rank and normal meshes.

availableParameters.name: cutting_mesh
availableParameters.title: Cutting Mesh
availableParameters.description: Limit the volume of this mesh to within other meshes. You can use this to make certain areas of one mesh print with different settings and with a whole different extruder.

availableParameters.name: mold_enabled
availableParameters.title: Mold
availableParameters.description: Print models as a mold, which can be cast in order to get a model which resembles the models on the build plate.

availableParameters.name: mold_width
availableParameters.title: Minimal Mold Width
availableParameters.description: The minimal distance between the outside of the mold and the outside of the model.

availableParameters.name: mold_roof_height
availableParameters.title: Mold Roof Height
availableParameters.description: The height above horizontal parts in your model which to print mold.

availableParameters.name: mold_angle
availableParameters.title: Mold Angle
availableParameters.description: The angle of overhang of the outer walls created for the mold. 0° will make the outer shell of the mold vertical, while 90° will make the outside of the model follow the contour of the model.

availableParameters.name: support_mesh
availableParameters.title: Support Mesh
availableParameters.description: Use this mesh to specify support areas. This can be used to generate support structure.

availableParameters.name: anti_overhang_mesh
availableParameters.title: Anti Overhang Mesh
availableParameters.description: Use this mesh to specify where no part of the model should be detected as overhang. This can be used to remove unwanted support structure.

availableParameters.name: magic_mesh_surface_mode
availableParameters.title: Surface Mode
availableParameters.description: Treat the model as a surface only, a volume, or volumes with loose surfaces. The normal print mode only prints enclosed volumes. "Surface" prints a single wall tracing the mesh surface with no infill and no top/bottom skin. "Both" prints enclosed volumes like normal and any remaining polygons as surfaces.

availableParameters.name: magic_spiralize
availableParameters.title: Spiralize Outer Contour
availableParameters.description: Spiralize smooths out the Z move of the outer edge. This will create a steady Z increase over the whole print. This feature turns a solid model into a single walled print with a solid bottom. This feature should only be enabled when each layer only contains a single part.

availableParameters.name: smooth_spiralized_contours
availableParameters.title: Smooth Spiralized Contours
availableParameters.description: Smooth the spiralized contours to reduce the visibility of the Z seam (the Z seam should be barely visible on the print but will still be visible in the layer view). Note that smoothing will tend to blur fine surface details.

availableParameters.name: relative_extrusion
availableParameters.title: Relative Extrusion
availableParameters.description: Use relative extrusion rather than absolute extrusion. Using relative E-steps makes for easier post-processing of the g-code. However, it's not supported by all printers and it may produce very slight deviations in the amount of deposited material compared to absolute E-steps. Irrespective of this setting, the extrusion mode will always be set to absolute before any g-code script is output.

availableParameters.name: slicing_tolerance
availableParameters.title: Slicing Tolerance
availableParameters.description: Vertical tolerance in the sliced layers. The contours of a layer are normally generated by taking cross sections through the middle of each layer's thickness (Middle). Alternatively each layer can have the areas which fall inside of the volume throughout the entire thickness of the layer (Exclusive) or a layer has the areas which fall inside anywhere within the layer (Inclusive). Inclusive retains the most details, Exclusive makes for the best fit and Middle stays closest to the original surface.

availableParameters.name: infill_enable_travel_optimization
availableParameters.title: Infill Travel Optimization
availableParameters.description: When enabled, the order in which the infill lines are printed is optimized to reduce the distance travelled. The reduction in travel time achieved very much depends on the model being sliced, infill pattern, density, etc. Note that, for some models that have many small areas of infill, the time to slice the model may be greatly increased.

availableParameters.name: material_flow_temp_graph
availableParameters.title: Flow Temperature Graph
availableParameters.description: Data linking material flow (in mm3 per second) to temperature (degrees Celsius).

availableParameters.name: minimum_polygon_circumference
availableParameters.title: Minimum Polygon Circumference
availableParameters.description: Polygons in sliced layers that have a circumference smaller than this amount will be filtered out. Lower values lead to higher resolution mesh at the cost of slicing time. It is meant mostly for high resolution SLA printers and very tiny 3D models with a lot of details.

availableParameters.name: support_skip_some_zags
availableParameters.title: Break Up Support In Chunks
availableParameters.description: Skip some support line connections to make the support structure easier to break away. This setting is applicable to the Zig Zag support infill pattern.

availableParameters.name: support_skip_zag_per_mm
availableParameters.title: Support Chunk Size
availableParameters.description: Leave out a connection between support lines once every N millimeter to make the support structure easier to break away.

availableParameters.name: support_zag_skip_count
availableParameters.title: Support Chunk Line Count
availableParameters.description: Skip one in every N connection lines to make the support structure easier to break away.

availableParameters.name: draft_shield_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Draft Shield
availableParameters.description: This will create a wall around the model, which traps (hot) air and shields against exterior airflow. Especially useful for materials which warp easily.

availableParameters.name: draft_shield_dist
availableParameters.title: Draft Shield X/Y Distance
availableParameters.description: Distance of the draft shield from the print, in the X/Y directions.

availableParameters.name: draft_shield_height_limitation
availableParameters.title: Draft Shield Limitation
availableParameters.description: Set the height of the draft shield. Choose to print the draft shield at the full height of the model or at a limited height.

availableParameters.name: draft_shield_height
availableParameters.title: Draft Shield Height
availableParameters.description: Height limitation of the draft shield. Above this height no draft shield will be printed.

availableParameters.name: conical_overhang_enabled
availableParameters.title: Make Overhang Printable
availableParameters.description: Change the geometry of the printed model such that minimal support is required. Steep overhangs will become shallow overhangs. Overhanging areas will drop down to become more vertical.

availableParameters.name: conical_overhang_angle
availableParameters.title: Maximum Model Angle
availableParameters.description: The maximum angle of overhangs after the they have been made printable. At a value of 0° all overhangs are replaced by a piece of model connected to the build plate, 90° will not change the model in any way.

availableParameters.name: conical_overhang_hole_size
availableParameters.title: Maximum Overhang Hole Area
availableParameters.description: The maximum area of a hole in the base of the model before it's removed by Make Overhang Printable.  Holes smaller than this will be retained.  A value of 0 mm² will fill all holes in the models base.

availableParameters.name: coasting_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Coasting
availableParameters.description: Coasting replaces the last part of an extrusion path with a travel path. The oozed material is used to print the last piece of the extrusion path in order to reduce stringing.

availableParameters.name: coasting_volume
availableParameters.title: Coasting Volume
availableParameters.description: The volume otherwise oozed. This value should generally be close to the nozzle diameter cubed.

availableParameters.name: coasting_min_volume
availableParameters.title: Minimum Volume Before Coasting
availableParameters.description: The smallest volume an extrusion path should have before allowing coasting. For smaller extrusion paths, less pressure has been built up in the bowden tube and so the coasted volume is scaled linearly. This value should always be larger than the Coasting Volume.

availableParameters.name: coasting_speed
availableParameters.title: Coasting Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed by which to move during coasting, relative to the speed of the extrusion path. A value slightly under 100% is advised, since during the coasting move the pressure in the bowden tube drops.

availableParameters.name: cross_infill_pocket_size
availableParameters.title: Cross 3D Pocket Size
availableParameters.description: The size of pockets at four-way crossings in the cross 3D pattern at heights where the pattern is touching itself.

availableParameters.name: cross_infill_density_image
availableParameters.title: Cross Infill Density Image
availableParameters.description: The file location of an image of which the brightness values determine the minimal density at the corresponding location in the infill of the print.

availableParameters.name: cross_support_density_image
availableParameters.title: Cross Fill Density Image for Support
availableParameters.description: The file location of an image of which the brightness values determine the minimal density at the corresponding location in the support.

availableParameters.name: support_conical_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Conical Support
availableParameters.description: Make support areas smaller at the bottom than at the overhang.

availableParameters.name: support_conical_angle
availableParameters.title: Conical Support Angle
availableParameters.description: The angle of the tilt of conical support. With 0 degrees being vertical, and 90 degrees being horizontal. Smaller angles cause the support to be more sturdy, but consist of more material. Negative angles cause the base of the support to be wider than the top.

availableParameters.name: support_conical_min_width
availableParameters.title: Conical Support Minimum Width
availableParameters.description: Minimum width to which the base of the conical support area is reduced. Small widths can lead to unstable support structures.

availableParameters.name: magic_fuzzy_skin_enabled
availableParameters.title: Fuzzy Skin
availableParameters.description: Randomly jitter while printing the outer wall, so that the surface has a rough and fuzzy look.

availableParameters.name: magic_fuzzy_skin_outside_only
availableParameters.title: Fuzzy Skin Outside Only
availableParameters.description: Jitter only the parts' outlines and not the parts' holes.

availableParameters.name: magic_fuzzy_skin_thickness
availableParameters.title: Fuzzy Skin Thickness
availableParameters.description: The width within which to jitter. It's advised to keep this below the outer wall width, since the inner walls are unaltered.

availableParameters.name: magic_fuzzy_skin_point_density
availableParameters.title: Fuzzy Skin Density
availableParameters.description: The average density of points introduced on each polygon in a layer. Note that the original points of the polygon are discarded, so a low density results in a reduction of the resolution.

availableParameters.name: magic_fuzzy_skin_point_dist
availableParameters.title: Fuzzy Skin Point Distance
availableParameters.description: The average distance between the random points introduced on each line segment. Note that the original points of the polygon are discarded, so a high smoothness results in a reduction of the resolution. This value must be higher than half the Fuzzy Skin Thickness.

availableParameters.name: flow_rate_max_extrusion_offset
availableParameters.title: Flow Rate Compensation Max Extrusion Offset
availableParameters.description: The maximum distance in mm to move the filament to compensate for changes in flow rate.

availableParameters.name: flow_rate_extrusion_offset_factor
availableParameters.title: Flow Rate Compensation Factor
availableParameters.description: How far to move the filament in order to compensate for changes in flow rate, as a percentage of how far the filament would move in one second of extrusion.

availableParameters.name: adaptive_layer_height_enabled
availableParameters.title: Use Adaptive Layers
availableParameters.description: Adaptive layers computes the layer heights depending on the shape of the model.

availableParameters.name: adaptive_layer_height_variation
availableParameters.title: Adaptive Layers Maximum Variation
availableParameters.description: The maximum allowed height different from the base layer height.

availableParameters.name: adaptive_layer_height_variation_step
availableParameters.title: Adaptive Layers Variation Step Size
availableParameters.description: The difference in height of the next layer height compared to the previous one.

availableParameters.name: adaptive_layer_height_threshold
availableParameters.title: Adaptive Layers Topography Size
availableParameters.description: Target horizontal distance between two adjacent layers. Reducing this setting causes thinner layers to be used to bring the edges of the layers closer together.

availableParameters.name: wall_overhang_angle
availableParameters.title: Overhanging Wall Angle
availableParameters.description: Walls that overhang more than this angle will be printed using overhanging wall settings. When the value is 90, no walls will be treated as overhanging. Overhang that gets supported by support will not be treated as overhang either. Furthermore, any line that's less than half overhanging will also not be treated as overhang.

availableParameters.name: cool_min_layer_time_overhang
availableParameters.title: Minimum Layer Time with Overhang
availableParameters.description: The minimum time spent in a layer that contains overhanging extrusions. This forces the printer to slow down, to at least spend the time set here in one layer. This allows the printed material to cool down properly before printing the next layer. Layers may still take shorter than the minimal layer time if Lift Head is disabled and if the Minimum Speed would otherwise be violated.

availableParameters.name: cool_min_layer_time_overhang_min_segment_length
availableParameters.title: Minimum Overhang Segment Length
availableParameters.description: When trying to apply the minimum layer time specific for overhanging layers, it will be applied only if at least one consecutive overhanging extrusion move is longer than this value.

availableParameters.name: seam_overhang_angle
availableParameters.title: Seam Overhanging Wall Angle
availableParameters.description: Try to prevent seams on walls that overhang more than this angle. When the value is 90, no walls will be treated as overhanging.

availableParameters.name: wall_overhang_speed_factors
availableParameters.title: Overhanging Wall Speeds
availableParameters.description: Overhanging walls will be printed at a percentage of their normal print speed. You can specify multiple values, so that even more overhanging walls will be printed even slower, e.g. by setting [75, 50, 25]

availableParameters.name: bridge_settings_enabled
availableParameters.title: Enable Bridge Settings
availableParameters.description: Detect bridges and modify print speed, flow and fan settings while bridges are printed.

availableParameters.name: bridge_wall_min_length
availableParameters.title: Minimum Bridge Wall Length
availableParameters.description: Unsupported walls shorter than this will be printed using the normal wall settings. Longer unsupported walls will be printed using the bridge wall settings.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_support_threshold
availableParameters.title: Bridge Skin Support Threshold
availableParameters.description: If a skin region is supported for less than this percentage of its area, print it using the bridge settings. Otherwise it is printed using the normal skin settings.

availableParameters.name: bridge_wall_coast
availableParameters.title: Bridge Wall Coasting
availableParameters.description: This controls the distance the extruder should coast immediately before a bridge wall begins. Coasting before the bridge starts can reduce the pressure in the nozzle and may produce a flatter bridge.

availableParameters.name: bridge_wall_speed
availableParameters.title: Bridge Wall Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the bridge walls are printed.

availableParameters.name: bridge_wall_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Bridge Wall Flow
availableParameters.description: When printing bridge walls, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_speed
availableParameters.title: Bridge Skin Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which bridge skin regions are printed.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_material_flow
availableParameters.title: Bridge Skin Flow
availableParameters.description: When printing bridge skin regions, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_density
availableParameters.title: Bridge Skin Density
availableParameters.description: The density of the bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

availableParameters.name: bridge_fan_speed
availableParameters.title: Bridge Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: Percentage fan speed to use when printing bridge walls and skin.

availableParameters.name: bridge_interlace_lines
availableParameters.title: Interlace Bridge Lines
availableParameters.description: When enabled, bridging lines will be printed interlaced, i.e. in 2 monotonic passes so that adjacent lines won't be printed just after each other. The lines of the first pass then have more time to cool down and are stronger when the second pass is added.

availableParameters.name: bridge_enable_more_layers
availableParameters.title: Bridge Has Multiple Layers
availableParameters.description: If enabled, the second and third layers above the air are printed using the following settings. Otherwise, those layers are printed using the normal settings.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_speed_2
availableParameters.title: Bridge Second Skin Speed
availableParameters.description: Print speed to use when printing the second bridge skin layer.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_material_flow_2
availableParameters.title: Bridge Second Skin Flow
availableParameters.description: When printing the second bridge skin layer, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_density_2
availableParameters.title: Bridge Second Skin Density
availableParameters.description: The density of the second bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

availableParameters.name: bridge_fan_speed_2
availableParameters.title: Bridge Second Skin Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: Percentage fan speed to use when printing the second bridge skin layer.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_speed_3
availableParameters.title: Bridge Third Skin Speed
availableParameters.description: Print speed to use when printing the third bridge skin layer.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_material_flow_3
availableParameters.title: Bridge Third Skin Flow
availableParameters.description: When printing the third bridge skin layer, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

availableParameters.name: bridge_skin_density_3
availableParameters.title: Bridge Third Skin Density
availableParameters.description: The density of the third bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

availableParameters.name: bridge_fan_speed_3
availableParameters.title: Bridge Third Skin Fan Speed
availableParameters.description: Percentage fan speed to use when printing the third bridge skin layer.

availableParameters.name: clean_between_layers
availableParameters.title: Wipe Nozzle Between Layers
availableParameters.description: Whether to include nozzle wipe G-Code between layers (maximum 1 per layer). Enabling this setting could influence behavior of retract at layer change. Please use Wipe Retraction settings to control retraction at layers where the wipe script will be working.

availableParameters.name: max_extrusion_before_wipe
availableParameters.title: Material Volume Between Wipes
availableParameters.description: Maximum material that can be extruded before another nozzle wipe is initiated. If this value is less than the volume of material required in a layer, the setting has no effect in this layer, i.e. it is limited to one wipe per layer.

availableParameters.name: wipe_retraction_enable
availableParameters.title: Wipe Retraction Enable
availableParameters.description: Retract the filament when the nozzle is moving over a non-printed area.

availableParameters.name: wipe_retraction_amount
availableParameters.title: Wipe Retraction Distance
availableParameters.description: Amount to retract the filament so it does not ooze during the wipe sequence.

availableParameters.name: wipe_retraction_extra_prime_amount
availableParameters.title: Wipe Retraction Extra Prime Amount
availableParameters.description: Some material can ooze away during a wipe travel moves, which can be compensated for here.

availableParameters.name: wipe_retraction_speed
availableParameters.title: Wipe Retraction Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted and primed during a wipe retraction move.

availableParameters.name: wipe_retraction_retract_speed
availableParameters.title: Wipe Retraction Retract Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted during a wipe retraction move.

availableParameters.name: wipe_retraction_prime_speed
availableParameters.title: Wipe Retraction Prime Speed
availableParameters.description: The speed at which the filament is primed during a wipe retraction move.

availableParameters.name: wipe_pause
availableParameters.title: Wipe Pause
availableParameters.description: Pause after the unretract.

availableParameters.name: wipe_hop_enable
availableParameters.title: Wipe Z Hop
availableParameters.description: When wiping, the build plate is lowered to create clearance between the nozzle and the print. It prevents the nozzle from hitting the print during travel moves, reducing the chance to knock the print from the build plate.

availableParameters.name: wipe_hop_amount
availableParameters.title: Wipe Z Hop Height
availableParameters.description: The height difference when performing a Z Hop.

availableParameters.name: wipe_hop_speed
availableParameters.title: Wipe Hop Speed
availableParameters.description: Speed to move the z-axis during the hop.

availableParameters.name: wipe_brush_pos_x
availableParameters.title: Wipe Brush X Position
availableParameters.description: X location where wipe script will start.

availableParameters.name: wipe_repeat_count
availableParameters.title: Wipe Repeat Count
availableParameters.description: Number of times to move the nozzle across the brush.

availableParameters.name: wipe_move_distance
availableParameters.title: Wipe Move Distance
availableParameters.description: The distance to move the head back and forth across the brush.

availableParameters.name: small_hole_max_size
availableParameters.title: Small Hole Max Size
availableParameters.description: Holes and part outlines with a diameter smaller than this will be printed using Small Feature Speed.

availableParameters.name: small_feature_max_length
availableParameters.title: Small Feature Max Length
availableParameters.description: Feature outlines that are shorter than this length will be printed using Small Feature Speed.

availableParameters.name: small_feature_speed_factor
availableParameters.title: Small Feature Speed
availableParameters.description: Small features will be printed at this percentage of their normal print speed. Slower printing can help with adhesion and accuracy.

availableParameters.name: small_feature_speed_factor_0
availableParameters.title: Small Feature Initial Layer Speed
availableParameters.description: Small features on the first layer will be printed at this percentage of their normal print speed. Slower printing can help with adhesion and accuracy.

availableParameters.name: material_alternate_walls
availableParameters.title: Alternate Wall Directions
availableParameters.description: Alternate wall directions every other layer and inset. Useful for materials that can build up stress, like for metal printing.

availableParameters.name: group_outer_walls
availableParameters.title: Group Outer Walls
availableParameters.description: Outer walls of different islands in the same layer are printed in sequence. When enabled the amount of flow changes is limited because walls are printed one type at a time, when disabled the number of travels between islands is reduced because walls in the same islands are grouped.

availableParameters.name: retraction_during_travel_ratio
availableParameters.title: Retraction During Travel Move
availableParameters.description: The ratio of retraction performed during the travel move, with the remainder completed while the nozzle is stationary, before travelingWhen 0, the entire retraction is performed while stationary, before the travel beginsWhen 100, the entire retraction is performed during the travel move, bypassing the stationary phase

availableParameters.name: keep_retracting_during_travel
availableParameters.title: Keep Retracting During Travel
availableParameters.description: When retraction during travel is enabled, and there is more than enough time to perform a full retract during a travel move, spread the retraction over the whole travel move with a lower retraction speed, so that we do not travel with a non-retracting nozzle. This can help reducing oozing.

availableParameters.name: prime_during_travel_ratio
availableParameters.title: Prime During Travel Move
availableParameters.description: The ratio of priming performed during the travel move, with the remainder completed while the nozzle is stationary, after travelingWhen 0, the entire priming is performed while stationary, after the travel endsWhen 100, the entire priming is performed during the travel move, allowing the print to start immediately

availableParameters.name: scarf_joint_seam_length
availableParameters.title: Scarf Seam Length
availableParameters.description: Determines the length of the scarf seam, a seam type that should make the Z seam less visible. Must be higher than 0 to be effective.

availableParameters.name: scarf_joint_seam_start_height_ratio
availableParameters.title: Scarf Seam Start Height
availableParameters.description: The ratio of the selected layer height at which the scarf seam will begin. A lower number will result in a larger seam height. Must be lower than 100 to be effective.

availableParameters.name: scarf_split_distance
availableParameters.title: Scarf Seam Step Length
availableParameters.description: Determines the length of each step in the flow change when extruding along the scarf seam. A smaller distance will result in a more precise but also more complex G-code.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_start_speed_ratio
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Start Speed Ratio
availableParameters.description: This is the ratio of the top speed to start with when printing an outer wall.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_acceleration
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Start Acceleration
availableParameters.description: This is the acceleration with which to reach the top speed when printing an outer wall.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_end_speed_ratio
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall End Speed Ratio
availableParameters.description: This is the ratio of the top speed to end with when printing an outer wall.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_deceleration
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall End Deceleration
availableParameters.description: This is the deceleration with which to end printing an outer wall.

availableParameters.name: wall_0_speed_split_distance
availableParameters.title: Outer Wall Speed Split Distance
availableParameters.description: This is the maximum length of an extrusion path when splitting a longer path to apply the outer wall acceleration/deceleration. A smaller distance will create a more precise but also more verbose G-Code.

availableParameters.name: ppr_enable
availableParameters.title: Enable Print Process Reporting
availableParameters.description: Enable print process reporting for setting threshold values for possible fault detection.

availableParameters.name: flow_warn_limit
availableParameters.title: Flow Warning
availableParameters.description: Limit on the flow warning for detection.

availableParameters.name: flow_anomaly_limit
availableParameters.title: Flow Limit
availableParameters.description: Limit on flow anomaly for detection.

availableParameters.name: print_temp_warn_limit
availableParameters.title: Print temperature Warning
availableParameters.description: Limit on Print temperature warning for detection.

availableParameters.name: print_temp_anomaly_limit
availableParameters.title: Print temperature Limit
availableParameters.description: Limit on Print Temperature anomaly for detection.

availableParameters.name: bv_temp_warn_limit
availableParameters.title: Build Volume temperature Warning
availableParameters.description: Limit on Build Volume Temperature warning for detection.

availableParameters.name: bv_temp_anomaly_limit
availableParameters.title: Build Volume temperature Limit
availableParameters.description: Limit on Build Volume temperature Anomaly for detection.

availableParameters.name: center_object
availableParameters.title: Center Object
availableParameters.description: Whether to center the object on the middle of the build platform (0,0), instead of using the coordinate system in which the object was saved.

availableParameters.name: mesh_position_x
availableParameters.title: Mesh Position X
availableParameters.description: Offset applied to the object in the x direction.

availableParameters.name: mesh_position_y
availableParameters.title: Mesh Position Y
availableParameters.description: Offset applied to the object in the y direction.

availableParameters.name: mesh_position_z
availableParameters.title: Mesh Position Z
availableParameters.description: Offset applied to the object in the z direction. With this you can perform what was used to be called 'Object Sink'.

availableParameters.name: mesh_rotation_matrix
availableParameters.title: Mesh Rotation Matrix
availableParameters.description: Transformation matrix to be applied to the model when loading it from file.
